Uq9ZqxIBaLNxSUwCCY5XCA.text: Everything was excellent!  My dad was in town from Chicago for the SOMA Lifetime Tri this past weekend. Needing a place for us to meet in the middle for brunch and something that wouldn't be so heavy since they were prepping for their race the next morning, I took to yelp to help guide me. Thank you yelpers for this great find!  The location is right off I10 west of 16th street on McDowell,  and a little seedy but you can tell it's up and coming... maybe! Don't let the neighborhood deter you from trying out this great spot.   The store is very bright and welcoming and so are all of the employees. We chose to sit outside on the back patio. They have an herb garden and nice patio tables. It was a great spot for brunch.  You order from the front and they bring the food to you. My dad's girlfriend ordered 3 of the small salads $2.50 each but all worth so much more. She ordered the arugula, the butternut squash, and one more I can't quite remember.  My favorite was the butternut squash salad.  I ordered the breakfast sandwich on a croissant and it was delish, no complaints.  My dad ordered the grilled cheese,  I tried it because he was raving about it and again very good. I love the mushroom and the cheese. I will order that when I come back.  Kids had the French Toast which were eaten up quickly.  There was not a delay in receiving our food, it came out quickly and the guys working here were super friendly and helpful.  The green tea was also very good.  The ingredients were fresh, this was a satisfying meal and I can't say enough good things, prices were very low as well especially for the quality of food you will get. We will be back for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great spot for brunch!

E8gLRBjv_TKgFmqXaKo-Yg.text: Their menu is sparse and I have only tried their breakfast but their ricotta pancakes are all you need to know. They are fantastic, the people working there are very nice and the space is pleasant. You can order sides as well.

COUOv-ti3nxKCgetHd6byg.text: Here is a place than makes a perfect over-medium egg. If that's how you like your eggs, you know what an elusive skill that is. Perfect spot for early Sunday morning breakfast.

rOAmLEApeIqr3IMuKJK6fg.text: Amazing croissants and lemon bars. Their breakfast sandwich is delicious, though very small for the price. The location and atmosphere are great. Overall, a great spot, even if the portions seem a bit small for the price.

zYxA5HZitlofWMe1YKLAHw.text: Husband and I had lunch here, the service was good and so was the food, great place to eat:)

yaYgRt6egRzkYCK5jgrJzA.text: Deeeelicious breakfast sandwich on the flakiest, tastiest croissant! I work at the hospital and we talk about this place weekly. So yummy!

8gZWhag2Kx7YHTq_q-cipQ.text: I have traveled the US and the world quite a bit. As the son of a Frenchman, I can safely say that the greatest croissants in the world are in France. After dining at Ollie Vaughn's I'm happy to report to the yelp world that I can tell you where the best croissants outside of France can be consumed.   I really really like their French toast. It's excellent. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a homemade French toast. But, Holy crap that breakfast sandwich is amazing.  It is an elite piece of art that belongs in a museum of breakfast sandwiches (which I assume would be in France)  This place is a small location that makes food from fresh ingredients, to order.  So understand when you come to eat here that this isn't Denny's where your food is almost ready to eat before you order it from their crappy corporate food-o-matic machine.   I hesitate to post this review, as I don't want to have to wait in a line around the building to eat here....but they do such amazing work, that they deserve to be that busy. Eat here, your tummy and your heart will be happy and thank you for it.

iXnuoHp8dzC9VZxiYHUEIw.text: On the good side: super cute store, great prices and yummy food.  Nice staff and lots of regulars.  The lemon bars are really tasty, too.  I plan to replicate the ham sandwich at home.  On the not-so-good side: I found a long hair in my sandwich after I took it home.  Few things gross me out more.  I wish you well, Ollie Vaughn's and may come back but you might want to consider some head coverings to avoid this happening again.

951JTD9jeaHfyU3KBRzX9A.text: Ollie Vaughn's is a great Coronado neighborhood spot that provides a salad when you want it, a pastry when you need it, a kick-butt toddy when you crave it, and a darling back patio.  Add to this Lindsey Magee's signature on the fresh and inventive kitchen, and you've got a hit.  On Thanksgiving morning, Lindsey opened for two hours to make sure those of us who forgot to order pies could gobble up some of her extras. The apple cinnamon was delicious, but the chocolate/walnut/fernet pie was the winner that night.

bt_83OhJWeM2CB8HWPRJKQ.text: After attempting to visit Ollie Vaughn's a couple times (but showing up when they were closed, boo!) the husband and I finally got to try this hidden gem out. The people who work here are lovely, friendly, and helpful people. We came at breakfast time during the week, so they weren't busy. Their egg sandwich is a 'build your own' egg sandwich, which I love! You can chose between a croissant or a biscuit (I got a biscuit), chose your cheese, how you want the egg, what meat you want, and veg. I had an over medium egg on biscuit with roasted tomatoes, gruyere cheese, and bacon.... it wasn't as good as my fave breakfast sandwich (when that one is good), but it was a close second. Very tasty and fresh. The husband had the biscuits and gravy... he loved it. The gravy was exceptional, they really let the quality of the ingredients shine... and it tasted good on the egg sandwich (new creation? I think so...). Their coffee was also good, they get it from a local roaster in Glendale. We also tried their cinnamon buns later that night, and they were soft and tasty... not overly sweet like some cinnamon buns can be. Needless to say, I will definitely be back!  PS Their decor is SO cute and their patio looks amazing if it weren't a thousand degrees outside  PPS 950, woohoo!

dcTBwwlGw-_EvPX5vQjItA.text: The place is beautiful inside and out! Dog-friendly patio and bacon treats available for your pup. I had the bagel and lox and half of a kale salad, both delicious. Everyone was really friendly. I'll be back for coffee and pastries!

gJHv_zA_-P4n7w6ItU5H2Q.text: Outstanding place for lunch!  Every sandwich I've tried has been delicious.  Great ingredients, creative food, and well made.  You also can't go wrong with the pastries and desserts.  I especially love their lemon bars, which have a creative twist with an ever so slightly rose flavored shortbread crust.  Great place and something this neighborhood really needed.

3vnslh_lMB8HWGAkNTQ3og.text: Sandwiches were really tasty, though for the price, I wanted at least a little flair on presentation.  Atmosphere was relaxing and quite unique - made me feel like I was back in Tucson at some hip 4th Ave joint.   I'll go back when I have the calories to spare for one of those amazing looking treats in the bakery counter!

agTpkUfEA8S_6zU5dm0dCg.text: Absolutely love this place. It's so cute on the inside and run by this super nice brother and sister duo. And their food is out of this world. We usually go for breakfast and I get the french toast. It's probably the best french toast I've ever had, so if you're a french toast connoisseur, do yourself a favor and head over to this place.   They also have really good coffee. They recently got a new coffee machine and that thing is wondrous. They have tons of little pastries and such that are so hard to pass up when it's time to leave, so yes, you should help yourself to a cookie or an oatmeal cream pie. There's also a cute little patio in the back with a garden.  This is a wonderful little spot in Phoenix that you should definitely take time to visit. My only complaint is that they aren't open on Sundays! Crossing my fingers that that changes in the future!

kFofBktJorq7C9Fc5B5BAA.text: This is probably my newest favorite coffee and breakfast place I've found. And the best part is, they use Ghirardelli chocolate for their mochas. This is rare (from what I've found) due to the premium cost of the sauce but it will pay two-fold in harvesting a strong customer base and retention rate. I also had their biscuits and gravy with an egg on top and it too was delicious. I never finish an order of these but I definitely did this time. I can't wait to take visiting friends here too and love the fact that it's right down the street from home. Kudos to the staff and owners!

sNmREqGAbF7Yu1451xhkQQ.text: I absolutely love this place! Lindsey is the sweetest and I am never dissapointed! I ordered Mexican tea cookies and cheescake bites for my wedding and my guests absolutely loved them!! Her pastries are legit and you can tell she uses quality ingredients.  Lately I've been obsessed with the turkey club on a croissant! It has avocado in it and the croissant is so flavorful and buttery! I can't say enough great things about the owner and the food.   Definitely a great spot in Phoenix and make sure you get a pastry! cookies, pie, cheesecake and so much more. This place is awesome and I'm so glad they opened near my neighborhood!

zGNXHXyoTaSOnp-uchw6tQ.text: Tried this place for the first time and loved it!  The veggie sandwich was perfectly delicious!  It's a cute place, and the outdoor seating is delightful. I had a chocolate chip cookie, too. Yummy!

M0919bKRhDGpaJ-9ILzKFA.text: My favorite spot for a quick breakfast croissant sandwich! Tasty; made to order, eggs, bacon, avocado,  gruyere cheese, caramelized onions,  arugula,  roasted tomatoes!! Need I say more?? Delicious baked goods as well!!

EzyDTU8KGwJXzBP-6Eakyw.text: After reviewing some Yelp reviews, we decided to try Ollie Vaughns for the first time. After walking in we were greeted & asked if we were ready to order....ok so I guess we order at the counter. We were then told we coud sit at a table while we decided & come back up to order so we went to find seating, none available (we didn't even notice the outside area). I said to 2 different employees that it was our first time there which would have been a PERFECT time to mention we had to set our own table & bus our own dishes but nope! Breakfast was $40+ for 3 of us. As we waited for our food, we noticed everyone bussing their own tables & finally noticed we didn't have silverware. Thank goodness we didn't tip on our debit card since I had cash because really, what would I be tipping for exactly? The food was ok, agree with other reviews about the fruit compote.. it was a sliced strawberry... not exactly my definition of compote. The baked goods in the front looked delish but we won't be back

gNp037jvYz7NFtS6cgDwkw.text: Decided to deviate from my usual lunch places after seeing all the reviews. The interior decor is very industrial with concrete floors and those giant tubular air vents. There's a big outside shaded patio that is the complete opposite with wooden furniture and a small garden. I really liked the outside, not so much the sterile-looking inside.   I got the large chicken salad which was good, not amazing though. It also took a long time to come out considering there was no one else at the place. The staff I thought was pretty aloof, almost as if they were doing me a favor by letting me eat there. All in all: food, good, decor, good, staff, weird.

It95LsRNsHFpJuIVnkGRcg.text: Cute, very cute.  The service was a little slow because the credit card machine (IPad) went down, but everyone was so nice about it, that you really didn't mind. I got a table in the back yard and had breakfast. I wish I would have had more time to just relax and enjoy my morning, because that's what cafes like this are made for.  I got the breakfast sammy and a caramel latte. The latte was *way too* sweet for me, so I could only drink about half of it before tossing. I understand that many people enjoy it this way, but I felt like my teeth were going to fall out. The sammy, on the other hand, was delightful, and I can understand how it is so popular.  Come here when you have a bit of time to relax, or when working on homework. It's that sort of place. Ask for light syrup in your latte though...

xBepWe6rNMqVRgSbTQX_Fg.text: This place is awesome. Was visiting a friend in AZ- I'd compare this place to any brunch restaurant in the New York food scene.  I got the sausage and ricotta pancakes! Both excellent. Came with a group of friends and we all left happy. Their customer service is great too, definitely recommend!!

r6NR1cYk3o4PH4WBsObs9w.text: Cool place like the food and the vibe   Good playlist and pastries are great like the hipster vibe.

ux0jOyDkus652kXmCTMahQ.text: I try and watch movies without reading reviews first. Netflix has a recommendation engine that analyzes and recommends videos based on previous watching history and ratings I submit. I have found Netlix's approach very effective at suggesting movies I enjoyed over the years. Here, on Yelp, I go to a restaurant based on an overall score which, in this case, is a human's opinion. But with over 200 reviews averaging out to 4.5 stars (as of this review posting) you tend to think there must be something going right here. Well, Yelp recommended Ollie Vaughn's as a Citizen Kane but I got The Room.  The location wasn't really where I had envisioned a cafe of higher caliber but hey, who am I to gauge gentrification? We entered the front door along a bustling Phoenix street into the quiet space in front of the counter where we selected our meals from the food offerings on their rather attractive menus. Prices were a tad higher than normal but this is quickly becoming the new normal in the area for these offerings. I hadn't yet noticed the decor or at least let it sink in but I did take note of the kitchen and its size compared to the rest of the dining space. It was a quite ambitious ratio. I wondered if this was an indication of a successful catering portion of their overall business. On to lunch.  I am a big fan of sandwiches so I chose the simple Turkey Club as the debut sandwich at Ollie Vaughn's. I like to do this for a set the bar on how someone can handle simple meals that also have lots of potential. I took a black tea for my beverage and we sat down in anticipation. What we received was lackluster in appearance. Sandwich, sliced in half, sandwich stickers to keep it in one piece. No pickle, greens, or something really savory like hand made chips. Alright, well, let's see what it tastes like. There was what tasted like a stewed tomato draped over a sparse allotment of avocado and lettuce on an ordinary tasting deli turkey between overly toasted sourdough. About three bites in this sandwich I determined to be "okay", much wanting for the price I paid. The black tea was black tea. My companions did mention their green tea was quite good, however. Perhaps I chose poorly on both fronts.  While munching on my "okay" sandwich is when I discovered the real looming disappointment; that decor I paid little mind on initial entrance to Ollie Vaughn's. Very white walls with an exposed ceiling structure above. While I appreciate a well executed exposed ceiling structure this was not it. I was suspect of water damage in the ceiling and them just removing the remaining ceiling element exposing the older not so gracefully aged wood beams underneath. The network of wires and conduit wasn't flattering either. Draw your eyes down and away from the upper portion of the establishment and we intersect with something more disheartening which is what Ollie Vaughn's deems as art placed on stark white walls. And not just art, but art on show for sale. We sat next to an unremarkable slightly paint spattered guitar set in a white shadowbox simply placed on the wall next to us. It was flanked by another similar white shadowbox filled with 3 different models of older Nintendo gaming controllers and a vintage film real, yes, in the same white shadowbox configuration. Prices? Guitar, $300. Nintendo controllers, $150. Film reel, I couldn't bring myself to look after the previous two offerings. The same plain white shadowbox presentation stretched around the whole dining area displaying a variety of mundane objects at exorbitant asking prices. One of the other diners in my group and I gazed at one particular item over the back entrance. We could tell it was a Ford Mustang grill in disrepair so we began the pricing speculation. $400? $500? We agreed $450 was probably asking price so I walked over to investigate. $750. I was speechless. The reason more being that there is a burgeoning art scene here in Phoenix, specifically in that area, that they could pull from. But rather than integrate a rich opportunity such as this, they chose to take what could ostensibly be considered junk, put it in a white shadowbox and proceed to display it for absurd prices in the name of art. It is an over the top pretentious move for an establishment who chooses to sell barely on par overpriced sandwiches in plastic baskets lined with wax paper.   I actually walked away from Ollie Vaughn's somewhat vexed. It was only on the way out of the restaurant did I notice the soft ambient electronic music which rounded out the grandiose hipster experience which had built up to that point. Thankfully I have options. There is Noble Eatery or Bertha's Cafe just down the road if I want a True artisanal meal. They don't try to be more than they are which is consistently notable food in a comfortable, non superficial environment. I'll pay extra for that.

RiLMdMAD7vkDP19dUVGyiA.text: This is probably my favorite breakfast place within all of Phoenix.  It's really well-decorated and the service is excellent!  I'm just visiting the area and have already been here twice.  The food here is really exceptional!

klZbJGsGmfiJTfUhWRfFQg.text: sweet casual little spot, relaxed vibe, great food and exceptional baked items. can't go wrong, enjoy!

I_p9d-GiFxscJMSIuVmuMg.text: This is a great breakfast, pastry, and coffee spot in the Coronado neighborhood. It never disappoints.

0kh9WEBYzXn6Xm1RV8UXnw.text: I enjoyed the diversity of the menu and the little quiet terrace im the backyard. The people working here seem to enjoy what they are doing and therefore have are always an open ear for suggestions making this restaurant a better place. I usually forget about time once I've entered here. Thank you for having me.

3AV8xQsnb_2K4qPsqeHJDQ.text: Biscuits and Gravy ... wow!  Totally the best I've had in a long time.  Fun environment, great coffee.  Definitely encourage you to try this place.  Yum.

8ApwOWkPTl7WRtMj6Z7oSg.text: Cute spot for breakfast! The ricotta pancakes are BOMB!!! My husband and i both ordered our own. Nice assortment of freshly baked goods that they'll heat up for you if you want  Yum!!

ADIzrBDz2S22b08UIP4TMA.text: Great local spot!! Friendly staff! Food was delicious. Ordered the breakfast sandwich with bacon. Was much better than your run of the mill sandwich. Unique ingredients. MUST TRY!!

kHkn2UVA3G4qBiZkpcGR4w.text: Amazing! The bakery options rival any place I have been to in the city. So far I have tried the turkey sandwich, lemon bar, and red berry pie!! The Turkey sandwich is divine with delicious roasted tomatoes which compliment the avocado and bacon perfectly. Lemon bars are the best I have ever had and the pie was tasty with a great crust. Planning on making this a weekly maybe even bi-weekly spot for my husband and I. Tomorrow I plan on stopping in and picking up one of their epic cinnamon rolls and a coffee.

uROI2nasv5rC7qih2tNv9g.text: Loved this low-key cafe! Short and simple menu with delicious espresso, what's not to love? I liked how you can customize a breakfast sandwich any number of ways - very interesting. I'd highly recommend getting croissant bread. Totally made the sandwich :) Also, if you can't find a seat don't be afraid to share a table!! You can make new friends while enjoying a trendy meal. I'll certainly be back!

Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One bite in!! Build your own sandwich... egg over easy, turkey, arugula, tomato, and avocado with a side of hash browns.

WTZIWp4JykXYCe-bT7Jbjg.text: Food is absolutely  delicious, atmosphere is cute and perfect date for my toddler and I. The staff is super friendly my daughter even wanted to invite them to her birthday party . Thanks guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Celebrating my daughter&#39;s 3rd birthday :)

hdmlcPfOsITZ-5vlkKcpew.text: My fiance and I were looking for a place to grab a quick eat before our drive back down to San Diego so after doing a few Yelp searches for lunch spots we decided on Ollie Vaughn's.    Don't be fooled by the exterior appearance of this cafe.  I was a bit hesitant considering I am not familiar with the Phoenix area.  I thought it looked a bit sketchy but I don't know I'm not from here!  I loved the mural on the side of the building in the parking area and the hair cut store next door looked quite trendy!  As soon as I stepped foot inside this cafe I was greeted by the friendly staff.  Their menu was simple a few sandwich and salad options and yummy baked goods in their glass case.    I ordered the chard grilled cheese which had rainbow chard, mushrooms, white cheddar & mozzarella. I added turkey to my sandwich and I had it on a brioche.  The fiance ordered a ham sandwich and a lavender iced tea. It doesn't stop there we also ordered a whoopie pie!  Portions were just enough for lunch and the sandwiches came with a little baked powdered sugar dusted cookie treat!  I really overindulged here but it was worth it.  Everything tasted fresh and delicious!  My sandwich was crispy ooooey gooooey!!  Yum!!!  I loved it and wanted more!  Prices were reasonable ranging from 7-8.50 for a sandwich.  10 for a sandwich and soup combo!  The ambience inside the cafe was very inviting....very vintage with the mason jars....loving the display of cookbooks which caught my attention Momofuku and Bouchon!  The outdoor patio dining area in the back with the herb garden and fruit trees was so cute and very great for the photo ops.  I overheard one of the other customers saying that the owner was going to change up the menu to use more ingredients from the garden for the upcoming spring menu.  Definitely recommend Ollie Vaughn's!!  Wish I lived closer but if I'm back in the Phoenix area I'll come back here for sure!

ZrW3xZA5g2inkTcKC9t-Vg.text: Ambiance: Medium sized urban cafe/coffee shop with uber-hipster vibe. 8 tables inside with 5 tables located in a covered patio with fruit trees. Usually no issue getting a table evening during the lunch rush. Clients are white collars and hipsters and college crowd.  Food: Amazing! The breakfast sandwiches are served all day and allow you to pick your bread (biscuit, Croissant etc) protein (sausage, turkey etc) cheese (cheddar, gruyere etc) egg (scrambled etc). They offer an equally amazing lunch menu with artisan soups, salads and sandwiches. All include culinary forward touches i.e. Chicken sandwhich includes jicama, green chiles, arugula etc. Again with the lunch sandwiches you have the ability to choose bread type (sourdough, marbled rye etc)  Price: Pretty good considering the ingredients and taste, most sandwiches around 8 dollars.  Service: Sometimes a bit slow but par for course for kitchens that put a lot of care in what they produce.   Overall: A great foodie lunch spot!

daSwrrgq6RdXpVlA_xuWbg.text: Decent biscuit and gravy, and there are a couple of cool perks about the place (decor, great little jars of jam) but for as empty as the place was, it took forever for us to get our orders and the prices were a little steep.  Worth an occasional stop, but it's in no danger of becoming a regular breakfast haunt for us.

NFTywaBSxvGzb6oMSAlV_Q.text: I am in this area a lot and have been wanting to check out Ollie Vaughn's, but always seem to around when it is closed, but one Sat I was just on time and happy to see it was opened!  This is such a cute shop, everyone is friendly and helpful, I love the outside patio seating area. The sweets on display looked amazing, next time I have to come back hungry. They even serve breakfast all day. I ordered an iced coffee, and it delsih!   Perfect for my Saturday adventures, since my son moved in this area, I know I will become a regular in no time!

2zfyo3E_65w8VzTNOA_2xA.text: This place is so cute. We stopped by during our road trip and it was the perfect little place to get some breakfast food and for our little pug to stretch her legs after being in the car for 7 hours. They even brought her water and a little snack :) I think we came pretty close to closing time so it wasn't too busy, very nice and quiet. The food was also delicious!

RPIPgPL4zXcanK0NUO_h7w.text: Ate a most delicious vegetable affair ( caramelized onions, roasted red peppers and garlic, avocado and peppery arugula) on a buttery bolillo roll while watching the owner making croissant dough.  Heaven.

fXi3EgdsLMDWcb3AZTSLwA.text: The service is not very good.  You have to get your own utensils and napkin which are located at the back of the store.  When I asked for a napkin I was rudely told they were located at the back of the restaurant.  Like I was supposed to know this already.  Then I watched this rough looking guy come in and he was looking at the pastries.  I think they thought he was homeless and they waited 3-4 minutes to even acknowledging him.  Very rude.    We ordered 2 sandwiches and 2 drinks for $23!!  The meatloaf sandwich was ok.  It was smothered with this sweet glaze.  The other sandwich was tuna fish which was way too sweet for my liking.    I agree with another reviewer that the staff is a little rude and dismissive.  I am not sure why they changed the menu.  They used to serve this AWESOME grilled cheese sandwich and a great roast beef sandwich.    The first time I visited this place was great.  Now, it's not that great.  Won't be going back.

umce-LNZ4MFxASzrM9OpzA.text: This revives ones inner hippie with coffee, tea, and food for attitude adjustment.  Nice variety and prompt counter service.

7fzU_lfc9UM_0S9DVfEXNA.text: Absolutely loved the lemon bar, some of the sandwich combinations can be quite weird

qM1WB-lrE-GSmr3v1Jb2eA.text: I've been here handfuls of times since, and the place is not only consistent, but getting better and better. Breakfast sandwich and lemon ricotta pancakes are our favorites. Bourbon pecan pie is outstanding (not too crunchy, not too mushy).

91gMlVlWB86oX7Knn_xUuQ.text: This is a quaint little sandwich shop with super yummy baked goods and home made sandwiches.  I had the turkey and dressing sandwich on whole grain.  It's a plate of Thanksgiving dinner on bread.  It comes with a homemade cookie that's amazingly decadent.  It's a MUST try!

OCoSHdtBAKcQt_0percl_A.text: Great location, close to work.  Love the friendliness of the staff and delicious food.  Highly recommend

nFmNDoJDVqLbVZlXXOBs1w.text: Picked up lunch here today and was really impressed. Not only great service and ambiance but most importantly great food! We had two sandwiches and a slice of the homemade cheesecake all of which was so fresh and tasty. We will be regulars for sure!

X9PTz2KE8cBpLJ8hvap6_g.text: Drive by this place every day, and finally just happened to notice it.  Had iced coffee, breakfast sandwich, cinnamon roll, and almond croissant.  Croissant was a bit tough on the ends, but cinnamon roll was very good.  Buttery doll rolled in cinnamon sugar - reminded me of a mini donut you get from the fair. Breakfast sandwich was also lovely, with thick cut delicious bacon.  Lady that took our order was very nice. Will come back to try the pie!

ELa6tt4Xp_r9nT-ud2xFfg.text: This is the kind of place that Phoenix needs more of.  Great local independent cafe with a simple menu full of very well designed and prepared food.  Nice, friendly environment.  Reasonable prices.  Unique flavors.  Its a winner in my book.

_-ERahMPwQLdi9tI8cpFag.text: Am I in Paris!? Quiche was to die for. Charming ambience, friendly staff. Check this place out!!!!

FZCj-brNaB3BKdecFMgXfA.text: Im out in Phoenix for the holidays and fell in love!  Hard to believe it was with a magnificent pie!  An icebox pumpkin pie to be exact!  I don't even eat pie so this was a unique love affair.  If I were to ever cheat on my usual desserts...I would be flying this mistress out to Austin, TX.

U2TUNApKEvD3BwMBKuv9Ug.text: My brother and I stopped through here on a cross country road trip, desperately seeking out alternatives to fast food on the road. Ollie Vaughn's did not disappoint. We had the egg salad sandwich and the tuna sandwich, and both were delicious. Friendly staff, and a nice vibe. Would definitely stop through again next time we're in Phoenix.

0wCF2pADr24Zt3ypaiJEUA.text: Bravo, Ollie!  I ate here for lunch twice this week, and will be coming back for more.  Tried the meatloaf and turkey sandwiches, paired nicely with a spring salad.  Sandwich proportions were perfect, and taste was superb.  I especially liked the dressing on the turkey sandwich.  This neighborhood is on the rise, and Ollie's seems to fit perfectly.  As to reviews by Winston R. and Meh M., typical Yelp passive aggressive haters.  Believe the hype, this place is for real.  Yummy!

LGFC_-2nR7uLqD28iKQgyg.text: My family and I ate here for Breakfast on Memorial Day.  The food was really good and the service was friendly.  We all had different things: quiche, biscuits and gravy, ham and cheese croissant, and the pork chili verde, all of us agreed, great food.  When leaving we walked by the bakery display, big mistake if you are trying to be good.  Had a cinnamon roll, FANTASTIC! Totally worth the calories.

DWPRdk-AJZhMgyR_t7Ftvg.text: A most AMAZING find! Delicious homemade food an pastries! Lindsay and Debbie are fabulous and the atmosphere is crisp, clean and airy. Had a breakfast sandwich and yummy coffee; even picked up an oatmeal pie for my room mate!

YMZIgydJKIfCNT1sOBy3GQ.text: I'm so bummed to write anything but a stellar review. The good; awesome space, great coffee, great baked goods. The weak; so-so service, the meatloaf sandwich was cold and tasted off. Biscuits and gravy left a lot to be loved. Not giving up on this place. Was scolded for not busing my own table also-- didn't love that. Seriously hope they can work out the kinks.

M-bInEqNrhDEfRo8FEmIYQ.text: Omg wow!!! Just moved to the area and used yelp to find a new barber but what i really found was unexpected. The barber mentioned this little cafe likebright next door. Ollie Vs... And it should be called Omie G's cause the food is amazing. I had the pork biscuit off the cashiers recomendation and was astounded by the flavor. The atmosphere and decore fit great and it was like stepping into another world from the rushing traffic outside. The quaint patio is cute and cozzy.The only complaint is the portion size was a little large and since it was so good i couldnt help myself from finishing it i am now a little beyond stuffed. Over all i cant wait to come back.

3cmox0CivHkGiB96Qw5WIA.text: So good! I wish I had the veggie biscuit. The cawliflowe and arugula salad was the best!

vLcQ97qPQxxQ6sEt052zLQ.text: Was put off by the name so hadn't gone in before (thought it would be too hipsterish). And the atmosphere was definitely hip with super clean lines, glass table tops, under-stated designer artwork. But so many places are these days (I was hoping for something a little funkier). The outdoor patio was quite nice with a very pretty herb garden in handmade wooden containers. Both my partner and I ordered sandwiches and the bread was clearly stale. Very dried out (which the toasting did not disguise). Perhaps previously frozen or just more than day-old. The two extra sides we ordered were good - a green side salad (altho would have preferred the thick layer of dressing on the side) and a mozzarella and tomato salad. My meatloaf sandwich had way too much "stuff" on it though; I could not even taste the meatloaf. They put cole slaw steeped in dressing on the sandwich and then the meatloaf itself had a too sweet sauce on it as well. Good meatloaf stands alone. Some of these new cafes try too hard to make their product "distinctive" and might be more successful with letting a good, more traditional homemade recipe stand on its own. The prices are a bit steep for a sandwich ($ 8.00) especially, as noted by another reviewer, that's all you get. Some of the desserts looked good (key lime pie) but did not try them. Not sure I will be back; I didn't find the atmosphere very comfortable - which is more of a personal preference than any fault of theirs.

JhAfb3zNoo0apt79-P7L3g.text: Ollie Vaughns is adorable! had the grilled cheese without mushrooms and added tomato. It was heavenly...crispy on the outside and melt in your mouth juicy on the inside. Yum!

3tU9kkiQE1e3_y9w-yK11w.text: Fantastic sandwiches! We shared the meatloaf and the ham sandwich. The meatloaf was DIVINE. The sauce was perfect and there was a bit of cole slaw on it that had a super lovely thai flavor. It was delicious. The ham was great too - yummy cheese and I loved the arugala on it. Will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu. Super sweet girl behind the counter and overall a very inviting atmosphere that was lovely to hang out in.

F7rD3QLf3rduUUQxGXRQOA.text: I stopped by this place on my way home from work. The neighborhood is sketchy but the inside of this place is beautiful. I had a breakfast croissant with bacon, Gruyere cheese, arugula and carmelized onions. It was the best I've ever had! The croissant itself was perfection. I also loved the lavender green iced tea.

3Q1OIA1w2bFxjRUXEeoEMQ.text: This place is just great. I was driving down McDowell and out of the corner of my eye, I saw this place Ollie Vaughn's. It just was calling out to me. I heard about it from some friends and was in need for a afternoon pick me up. So I pulled over and went in to get a cup of coffee.  I got a iced tattie and a Brownie. I drank the Tattie and shot the stuff with the young man at the counter. He was a character and had a great personality. We talked music and he easily up sold me on the brownie.  The coffee was no joke, got me good and fired up to go purchase those tires that I was originally set out on the mission to get in the first place. Since I was on my way to get new tires, the vibe of my afternoon was of the chore variety, and not of the kick back one. When I left Ollie Vaughn's , I was in a much better head space and was able to deal with having to perform the rest of my day with a much better outlook.  These are the type of experiences I take with me and remember when going to a new spot.  Oh yeah ! The Brownie was absolutely insane and gave my girlfriend and I both our chocolate fix for the day, "we ate it later that evening". I would recommend this place to anyone.

YbRWUpFJVSb_uEb9lb3Icg.text: Wow, loved everything about this cute little spot! The outside garden seating was wonderful! Butternut salad was to die for, I would highly recommend trying it while it's still in season. Service was ok. Would really love to see more options for a vegetarian sandwich. I know anything they would make would be awesome! I will definitely be back next time I'm in PHX!

YHi-NABLAubtUftEkDNVGA.text: Wonderful lunch place we found today. I had a delish turkey club (with the best bacon, ever) and my companion had ricotta pancakes. Yum! The prices were fair, service great and we even had a nice chat with the owner (?) who was busy baking a lot of the goodies to be had. My only complaint is that the menu offers few selections, especially in the salad department. That's a personal preference thing, and no real reflection on the restaurant. Will definitely be going back for the lemon bars!

QN8mJNsAHgYm1Rmc19WtrQ.text: This is my first Yelp review. Amazing food, great prices, a awesome atmosphere, cool patio, chill people and delicious pastries. It's my new favorite spot!!

Rhp3cXNWVugq1y_2YIyn4Q.text: Was in the neighborhood last weekend and I finally got to have lunch at Ollie Vaughn's.  Greeted with friendly service in a restaurant with a charming interior. On this lovely day in Phoenix, we chose to dine outside. The patio had the perfect balance of sun and shade, along with fruit trees and a selection of vegetables and herbs growing in the back. The perfect place to dine and enjoy a beautiful sunny day.   I opted for the chard grilled cheese sandwich with mushrooms on a toasted brioche, with a tasty bowl of soup, which made for the perfect lunch paring.  I also sampled the kale salad- the dressing was delicious, citrusy and crisp. There were also many tempting  deserts in the bakery case, unfortunately at this point I was stuffed. I can't wait to come back and sample some more of the sandwiches, soup, and salads- next time I'll save room for desert!

o0NuSv8kTFA58f2ig1EJmA.text: Fresh, housemade, talented, totally yummy. Comfortable, casual, eclectic environment. I know good restaurants, go here!!!

Yeha2nA_SP21W62BvZPbRg.text: Finally, a cool place for an up and coming neighborhood. I was lucky to stumble on OV's, and was pleasantly surprised since. The deserts are some of the best, although I never seem to be able to get in on the days they make cheesecake (I guess it disappears quickly). The sandwiches are pretty good, and it seems like they change them up regularly. They have nice outdoor seating in back, and a really cool open kitchen inside.  An actual sense of community because of all the regulars - the day I was there a group of people were having a weekly book club meeting. I didn't know books still existed...

M9gM-mrcefS99ejY-RmCww.text: I am so glad we came across this spot for breakfast. The coffee is nice and strong and holy moly their food is amazing! The best chile verde I've had from a restaurant. Their pork chile verde is healthily topped on top of an awesome biscuit and a fried egg after that. I love that the pork isn't too saucy. It's cooked with green chilies and the pork melts in your mouth. I can't wait to go back for some more. My husband ordered a bacon egg cheese green chilies sandwich and it looked super good. I couldn't get past my own plate to try his haha. Can't wait to go back when we're in the area. Customer service is amazing as well! Thank you!

MkKrI_R6oPoraaWR46I3zQ.text: Love this place, totally chill vibe, great food, very friendly. I'll definitely be back!!!!

T18AOSjfRLOe8-Q-2b5iuw.text: A friend brought me here and is now at the top of my list for coffee or breakfast. My new goal is to try each item they have as it was hard to choose  I love being able to see in the scratch kitchen where magic is made.

SrZC4Koi6BmsCHJXc8n56w.text: What a surprise Ollie Vaughns is for the location! We stopped in for an early lunch on the way from Phoenix to Vegas and glad we did.   The Cuban sandwich, just get it! Mmmm, it was fantastic, really a great version with the pork, chili verde and ham. Husband and son had the Club, it was kind of boring, lots better options available! My daughter had the Ricotta Pancakes and said they were the best pancakes she has ever had. That is high praise from a girl who eats a lot of waffles and pancakes.   The only downside happened when I spilled my water. No one behind the counter offered to help. Finally I asked for a rag, and the one they handed me can best be described as filthy, and that's being generous. It soaked up the water on my table and then I used some napkins but the floor remained wet and no one ever came out to mop it or wipe it during our visit.

VioQUJafVKVFn8S7aYa5Iw.text: They make the absolute best breakfast sandwich I've ever had, and I wish I could eat it every day. Get it on the homemade biscuit -- OMG.  I love the coffee and tea drinks here as well, and the dirty chai is perfectly balanced (which is uncommon at many coffee places). I've had a few other baked goods and sandwiches here, which are also good, but I just keep coming back for the breakfast sandwich.  The service is pretty slow, but that's because they're making everything fresh and from scratch.   Unfortunately there have been multiple occasions where I can't find anywhere to sit. Last time I was here, there were no available tables inside, and the patio was way too hot (they don't have misters), so we had no choice but to run back to the counter after we'd already ordered, and tell them we had to take it to go because there wasn't seating available for us. Such a bummer because this place is adorable and nice to hang out at. I'm sure there's nothing they can do to help with indoor seating, but if they could put some misters outside, at least it would be a semi-comfortable option during the summer.  All this to say, I'm a big fan of Ollie Vaughn's food, drinks, and atmosphere. But I recommend either coming during a slower time, or being prepared to take your food to go!

phVDZpEdglggmPAh9KC4tQ.text: The food and service here is fantastic. However, my husband and I will not be coming back because of their policy of allowing dogs inside the restaurant. Now that's changed here so for my own comfort I will stay away. But if you're ok with that you will not be disappointed with the food.

I ordered the breakfast sandwich (Check-in on Yelp and get 25% off of your breakfast sandwich!!!!) and it was on a buttery croissant that was just fantastic. The fiance got their biscuits + gravy and it was insanely good. It was somewhat like a pot pie and she literally scooped the homemade biscuit batter on top as we were standing there. Talk about FRESH!! Their patio is adorable and it is completely dog friendly, equipped with water bowls and they even brought Oscar some burnt bacon! Like really?! We've found a new favorite {hidden} spot and will absolutely be back soon! Thank you for the amazing service, Ollie Vaughn's team! (Oscar is still salivating over that crispy bacon!)  P.S. I desperately wanted one of their homemade oatmeal whoopie pies but stopped myself. I may cave-in next time because I can't stop thinking about it!

XGHK-wW2zGdoBUEtrEnCxg.text: I hope that this place turns out to be ahead of the curve with the location and more good food spots pop up in the area. That said, it is rough from the outside, with the front window right on McDowell Rd. Once inside, however, great things happen. The atmosphere is casual and hip. It is short order, with payment at the time of ordering. Staff has always been nothing but friendly to me.   Behind the front counter you can see them hand making all of the baked goods, which are delicious. The croissants are flaky and crispy just as they should be, and the biscuits are crumbly with a pleasing crunch on the outside. The green chile with biscuits and eggs is my go to. You get a very good sized breakfast made fresh from scratch for right around $10.   The back patio (back yard) is a unique and appealing feature. Step into the yard and instantly forget that McDowell Rd is 50 feet away.

They've got nice selections for lunch too, so I may have to stop by again and try those. Glad I made it out here.

erBrbAdRQV66sdihFyt3WQ.text: The Downtown Phoenix area has more than its fair share of great breakfast spots.  Matt's Big Breakfast, Vovomeena, Lo-Lo's, and Duza's Kitchen just to name a few.  There's also an abundance of great coffee houses such as Lola's, Be, JoBot, Fair Trade Cafe, and Giant.  Many attempt to be great at both breakfast and coffee, though I've discovered more than a few that sometimes don't put a strong enough emphasis on the food product versus the coffee.  Ollie Vaughn's is attempting the trifecta of being a coffee house, breakfast/lunch spot, and bakery.  No easy feat.  Lux Central comes to mind when I think of such places and my experience there was pretty decent.  So I came here for breakfast on a Saturday morning, lured by the positive Yelp reviews.  The cafe is a fairly cute setup with an array of seating options both inside and out.  The interior has booths, bar seating near the front, as well as casual sit down tables.  One thing I should mention is the table seating has metal chairs.  After sitting down for awhile in my chair, it became a little uncomfortable.  A minor issue, sure, but if I'd wanted to hang out here for awhile, I probably would need to move around constantly.  The outdoor patio out back has additional table seating as well, bringing total capacity of this place to about 40-50 from what I could gather.  When you come in the front door, the bakery case is right there tempting you with everything from lemon bars, to cinnamon rolls, to oatmeal pies, and other tasty looking stuff.  Maybe next time, but this morning it was all about breakfast for me.  I decided to go with their breakfast sandwich (you get a 25% discount on it with a Yelp check-in) and their ricotta pancakes seemed like a crowd pleaser with Yelpers so I got those too.  Total cost including tax was about $15.  Food came out about 5-10 minutes later.  The breakfast sandwiches here are such that you can customize them yourself.  I went with a croissant for my bread (you have the option of biscuit as well), turkey for my meat (you can also go with bacon, ham or sausage), had my eggs scrambled (you can have the eggs done however you want), cheddar for my cheese (gruyere is your other option), and arugula for my veggie (there's at least a half dozen other veggies to choose from as well).  The ricotta pancakes are, well, pancakes made with ricotta.  Came with strawberries and maple syrup.  Oddly, the butter was already applied to the pancakes rather than on the side for me to apply myself.  I suppose it wasn't a big deal since these pancakes didn't really need more butter than was already applied.  Though I suspect most customers would probably want the option to apply butter or not, and how much of it.  Anyways, let's get to the food grades.  The breakfast sandwich was delicious.  Granted, it was customized by yours truly, but the croissant was light with just enough crunch and there was a generous portion of turkey, eggs, and cheese on this sandwich.  Solid breakfast sandwich all around.  As for the ricotta pancakes, I liked the fact that the texture of these pancakes were lighter and fluffier than most pancakes I've had and didn't require tons of butter to keep them moist.  That said, there really wasn't anything flavor wise that stood out to me.  Honestly you could've told me these were just normal pancakes made using a different cooking method and I would've totally believed you.  The ricotta flavor wasn't pronounced at all and aside from the syrup, I really didn't pick up much flavor in these period.  They weren't bad, just sorta bland.  The strawberries and syrup that came with it made up the difference, but the ricotta pancakes themselves weren't a standout item in my opinion.  The staff here was very friendly and it appeared there were quite a few regulars from the neighborhood conversing with the staff so you'll definitely come away feeling like you've entered a neighborhood haunt.  Perhaps next time I'll give the lunch menu and the bakery items a try.  As a breakfast spot though, I can't say it stood out in any real unique way for me.  But you might come away with a different verdict.  Hopefully I do too the next time I'm here.  Though I'll probably need to make sure I get a more comfortable chair.

-1ePWElzmgiXq3l3xhG9_w.text: Part of me doesn't want to leave this review because I don't want more people finding out about this gem (its my secret) but I must give credit where credit is due. This place is outstanding. The coffee is smooth and rich, and I recommend the quiche, the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit or a croissant (they usually run out of biscuits so go early), the pork chile verde, the biscuits and gravy, and my list goes on and on. Can't go wrong with anything they serve on the menu.   From the outside this place doesn't look like much but don't let the seedy warehouse appearance scare you away.Just go.

JanxMXLElH1rOOp6bgHAdw.text: You can't beat fresh!  This place is a trendy, made to order eatery. The kale salad is hearty & filling. The veggie breakfast Sammy is PACKED full of wholesome veggies & I could honestly say it's the best I've ever had,  especially for the cost. Pro tip: order all the veggies & save a buck. The coffee has been nothing short of delicious. I'm very picky about my coffee, being a barista for 5+ years. You can tell they pride their coffee quality as much as they do the art of making good food. I appriciate that in a restaurant. Customer Service rocks too! Forget your silverware? Don't worry,  they'll go back & grab it for ya! Always greeted with a smile at the door too. Music is a little louder, but still able to hold a conversation across the table. I have only been in when there is only about 2 other parties in the room though. They have a really cute patio space in the back. Even have a little play house in the back for kids. The best part are the citrus trees filled with fruit in the right season. Overall, I'm a new regular!

-7lmYKJbqcq89DiWVy_wtw.text: Wow!! What a gem! So nice to have another amazing restaurant in the Coronado hood. I've driven past Ollie Vaughn's almost everyday since moving back to the Valley.  Since they close at 3pm I've never had the chance to stop in, because lunch isn't usually a meal I go out of my way to eat.  That will all be changing, OV's just won me over with a simple but amazingly delicious sandwich.  I ordered the Meat Loaf Sandwich, talk about a flavor explosion!  The Hoisin Meatloaf was absolutely mouth watering, throw in some fresh local cabbage and that carrot and radish slaw and you got yourself one of the best sammies in the valley!!! I also had a few bites of the Tuna Salad sandwich. It was very good. The Jalapeno Marmalade made it sweeter than I'm used to, but still very scrumptious.  They also offer breakfast and an array of fresh bakery items--everything is made from scratch. I cannot wait to try another amazing sandwich on the menu.

Uii0PAMdE36C7BJxgMaKnw.text: Bam! This place is so money! I've driven by this place so many times always wondering about this cool looking cafe being on this block. Today, I dropped in for lunch and so glad I did. First, let's start with the well designed space, with a great soundtrack, and a friendly and laid back staff. I ordered the Cubano and my wife the tuna. The Cubano was one of the best I have had. It's hard to make a good Cubano. And they did it. My wife's sandwich, while looking simple without a bunch of fancy fillers, was so much more than simple. The flavors were unique and delicious. Two thumbs up. I hope this place keeps its charm and delicious food.

KX_M2fDMKtwAC229ik1xNA.text: This place is amazing. It's an out of the box restaurant with the mom and pop feel. The ambience is peaceful and relaxing and the service was wonderful. And the food was out of this world!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade biscuits and gravy.

KxjNPOj0Jc0xwjFXBqeMPA.text: Tucked in a really old commercial strip, this charming restaurant has become a family favorite for breakfast. There are wonderful goods baked on site and you can watch the cooks make everything in the open kitchen behind a counter top fronted with pressed tin. Try the very reasonably priced bagel and lox, ricotta pancakes, pork chili verde and other yummy selections.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Counter at Ollie Vaughn&#39;s.

80W97mHMxp5wqR_9S0R05Q.text: I really wanted to like this place but was a little disappointed in the portion size of my food. I like my breakfasts to be hearty and satisfying. This just wasn't the case with what I ordered: egg cheddar arugula and avocado on a croissant with hash browns and a large coffee. Everything was measly besides the coffee. The croissant was buttery and crispy and the cheese was good but it was all too small and I just couldn't justify the price. The hash browns weren't any more impressive- no larger than 1/4 cup and they were absent of flavor, really. I would say that if you're like me and want a big breakfast that makes you full and happy then there are other places nearby that are way more generous for the same price. That or maybe try something else here that's not a sandwich.  Other than that, I do really like the atmosphere of this place- nice and quaint. It's like Lux but more chill. They have a friendly staff that waves goodbye from the kitchen when you leave which is cool. I will probably come back for coffee and treats sometime which look yummy!

w0_gZlrXMJJFRfypiQrLsg.text: Quiet. Cute. Friendly. Delicious. Lemon bars for days!  I'm reviewing late, since I went for the first time about a year ago, but I have been jonsin' for another lemon bar since.  Could a person ask for anything more?  No. The answer you're looking for is no.

bNiSq8V7gg_RmU3K3x8zXQ.text: Hide gem! This new age style eatery is a fantastic place to enjoy a breakfast sandwich and coffee, dog friendly patio. Enjoyed Lots and Begel, and Tottie. Friendly staff, clean environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

10THDiJwgwzt16-CGoGEsg.text: Cool place but the service was SLOOOOOOOOOW, we were almost the only ones in there and it it took 45 mins before my sandwich came out. I won't go back.

mMAWgvBOvLarML548905pw.text: The food is a "4" but the service leaves a lot to be desired. The order process is very similar to fast casual places (order & pay first, then food brought to table). In addition to this, you are prompted to tip upfront. As another reviewer pointed out, how can I tip prematurely, without the service being provided? We are very mindful of people in the service industry & pre-tipped 15%.  Mind you, we are also not expecting to have the red carpet rolled out for us.   We had a simple order- two coffees, pancakes & biscuit/gravy @ 10:45 am and received our food at 11:40am. Keep in mind, this was after we inquired @11:30 for the status- all we got was "your ticket is next". We understand brunch can be hectic & food can take a bit longer to prepare- however, our issue is the fact that they didn't take onus, accountability or provide an explanation for the delay.  We were seated facing the kitchen and knowing that the biscuits/gravy were ready to serve (in a pot), we were dumbfounded that it took so long to cook the pancake batter.  There seemed to be a lack of prioritization with orders or maybe ours was placed on the back burner, pun intended.   To me, small business owners/management should be ensuring that all their customers have a pleasant experience & being oblivious to poor service is uncalled for.  At no point were we told the food will take longer than expected (at the time of order or while twiddling our thumbs while seated at our table).    For this foodie, it's not just about the food, it's the culmination of the overall service & experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Looks great, doesn&#39;t it? That&#39;s what 50 minutes of prep looks like.

s5Dl4My4-_W5ojQ7L8M-qA.text: I highly recommend this little coffee shop the biscuit is so perfectly cooked and fresh in the green chilies at a really nice touch. The service is fast and great and the food is delicious

vSzt8SFxgurQdiv8hd6Agw.text: Great breakfast croissants!  And biscuit sandwich!  Back patio is great when weather is cooler

7ak5msPnwljAv6bK9ZcLrw.text: Just moved to the neighborhood and am so excited to have this place right around the corner. Great vibe and delicious food.

I8E3Zb4xfCPfpFPsjQafGw.text: We love stopping in for the breakfast sandwiches. The croissants are AMAZING!!!!!! Pastries are wonderful as well! Thank you for an welcoming atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food!

lt269PS0Q7nT3nDgQOjBRA.text: I really love Ollie Vaughn's, but the coffee is straight up funky. And not in a cool 70's/James Brown sorta way ... in a WTF is this I'm tasting?! sorta way.   Anyway.   You should, like, totally skip the coffee. Everything else about this place is way cool, though. Like way, way cool.   Like if it smells like funk, it must be that latte you ordered.   Like if you break out in a cold sweat, again, it's the latte. Stop ordering those.   Like if you're doing the Jerk or the Mashed Potatoes or the Jump Back Jack ... you really need to take my advice already. It's obviously that stank-a** cup of funk you call coffee.   Way sorry, but if you wanna feel nice like sugar & spice ... try a green tea and a cookie.

asFZ_ix6hSfgV86QFhGn-A.text: Stopped in at 1pm for lunch no one in the place yet no ice tea and food orders are a half hour wait. First and last visit.

V1Nd8BYjoPMUKfsdL5ZCiQ.text: We loved it! Great inexpensive food and drinks. Very dog friendly. Our new go to breakfast/coffee shop. Thank you!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TpQ8eD434u8lpcTlwWMrpw.text: Items Selected:  Ham and Gruyere Croissant Almond Croissant Ricotta Pancakes with Vermont Maple Syrup and Fruit Compote Carrot Cake Nutella Roll Pecan Bar Chocolate Croissant Pudding Chocolate Banana Walnut Bread  Continuing to show signs of a dining scene on the rise, several artisan bakeries moving step-in-step with flourishing Wineries and organic Produce grown in the northern part of the State, places like Ollie Vaughn's were virtually unheard of as little as four years ago, the high hipster quotient tolerable thanks to the good service and even more impressive products.  Small and easily passed by, signage along East McDowell Road blending into a background of street art and a disheveled gallery next door, parking is readily available in an adjacent lot with entrance immediately tempting patrons with baked goods, additions added throughout the day as the small restaurant transitions from Breakfast to Lunch.  Best described as a full-service Coffee Shop, the focus on well-sourced Beans and scratch-cooking evident even before perusing a small menu, it was with wide-eyes that a party of three perused glass cases and pedestals, a total of seven items from Quick-Breads to Viennoiserie selected and offered warm in addition to one made-to-order plate from the kitchen.  Locally owned and operated, the 7a-3p hours making Ollie Vaughn's an ideal workday stop for both downtown denizens and those on the outskirts, it was on intentionally mismatched plates that each selection was brought forth individually by a young man with big spacers, bright hair and pointed fingernails - all items presented with a brief description mere moments before tucking into the toasty Ham & Cheese Croissant as well an Almond version that were each chock-a-block full of bold flavors without compromising the shattering exterior integrity.  Receiving the plate of Pancakes more quickly than anticipated, a pillowy Ricotta base and Fruit Compote impressing even skeptics, more good bites were found in a coiled Nutella Roll that surprisingly allowed the spread to dry into a Brownie-like core at its center while the dark mound of Croissant Pudding was as moist, dense and rich as expected with Chocolate slightly melted by a quick rewarming trip to the oven.  Not particularly sold on the Carrot Cake, too much sweet and not enough spice beneath a dollop of Cream Cheese Frosting, both the Pecan Bar and Chocolate Banana Walnut Bread fared far better, the former going light on Brown Sugar filling while doubling-down on Nuts and a buttery Crust while the latter is weighty and well-advised for sharing even though pockets of Dark Chocolate Chips and bitter Walnuts ensure that no two bites are exactly the same.

FQ7KanUVR-Q_aB_UINMTqg.text: Lunch with a colleague was lovely - both due to the company and the meal. I enjoyed the smoked tomato soup - which was especially good in this weather - and a piece of red pepper quiche. This is a fun place, with an attentive staff and quality food. I will add that the large parking lot makes it very accessible. Worth the trip. I will be back!9

zLAJl3ijZb68oYkg0fto_w.text: Breakfast the most important meal of the day.  Its been said that breakfast is the most important meal of the day, and Ollie Vaughn's is probably one of the best places for breakfast in town. Not only is the service and food fantastic at Ollie Vaughn's but, where else can you get a delicious, made from scratch breakfast for $6 bucks.  I love the biscuits and gravy at Ollie Vaughn's, however the French toast is always a good choice.  The french toast is thick, crispy, and fluffy light in the middle, just like French Toast should be.  On my next visit I plan on trying the "build-your-own breakfast sandwich" which are also made to order. You can choose between a croissant or a biscuit,  then you get to load it up with your choice of meat, cheese, and veggies.   So if your searching for the most  important meal of day that won't be break the bank look no further Ollie Vaughn's is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna on Sourdough

t_wXHlv7YuGkAIV114akiA.text: The level of flakiness in these biscuits are freaking amazing ,this is my first time here .I had a biscuits and gravy with a couple sunny side up eggs and a side of bacon and it full filled all of my Midwest dreams of perfectly pillowy biscuits standing up to a heaping amount of gravy keeping their integrity while being a perfect platform for the GRAVY!!!!so good. My gf had the pork chilli verde Also fantastic. Bursting with flavor. All the staff are nice and welcoming. Great vibe. #localphxbitch!

u_wpU5-ZDR5cPQpswO3YsQ.text: There need to be more places like Ollie Vaughns. Amazing food. Everyone is in a good mood. And prices are great. What is there not to like?

0hRk7csuMzlKmeAl-4_gvA.text: I love this place so so much! Great desserts and really nice service every time we go. I love ordering the biscuits and gravy. You gotta get there early on the weekends bc they run out!

KHsoQx0hkxDpQICNqIh5FQ.text: This is a wonderful breakfast place, with great options and layed back local atmosphere. The employees are top notch; helpful and knowledgable. & the decor! I went with a friend, and we each had the American Breakfast (I know, boring), but it was perfectly cooked, large portions, and reasonably priced. The menu really is creative and expansive, so if we ever get there again, I will venture farther out of my breakfast comfort zone. We had traveled up from the Verde Valley for a medical appointment, so  referenced Yelp to find this fine restaurant. Go Yelp! You rarely let me down. Oh...forgot to mentoin the luscious appearing pastries in a glass case in the front. Yum! Go to Ollie Vaughn's! You won't regret it.

iXyJ8KQ3V5IvOePRVs-LSw.text: Delicious ricotta pancakes! Ive passed this place for years and never stopped in. So happy I finally did! Order at the counter,  quick table service... simply delicious!

5L6D291_fVQ2o1AhyIudjA.text: I almost don't want to write this review. Seriously, I love this place so much I want it to stay under the radar so it doesn't get crazy busy. The food is consistently amazing (the bacon biscuit breakfast sandwich and biscuits and gravy are my favorite). It's got a really cute vibe inside, and all of the staff are wonderful. Personally, their desserts aren't really my favorite, but that's ok with me. I really really wish they were open on Sundays. It's not "in the ghetto" as another reviewer mentioned - just in an urban area.

g0YJSb3l91w9-OsH4UABwA.text: Great little breakfast/lunch spot downtown. Friendly service and nice atmosphere. Good quality good prepared well. Nice outdoor patio/herb garden to relax and eat in...a quaint little dinner with a nice vibe to it

V7wgLokDlBy2cLzzsw5cHg.text: This is a True diamond in the rough. You wouldn't expect such a great spot from the outside, but it's all quality on the inside. Exceptional food and great atmosphere make this spot a clear win for the Coronado community.

bLiFpJtOI-xt5_RiJG6ngg.text: Nice place for breakfast or just a coffee.  Cool building with a great interior.  They have a patio in back that is great when the weather is cooler.

J5E2hSM11-Ba0LforXVvrA.text: Everytime I eat here, usually once a week or every other week, I am never disappointed. The crew here are super nice. The food is absolutely delicious! I usually go for the breakfast sandwich and switch back and forth from the croissant to biscuit. I am obsessed with their oatmeal cream pie. The prices for all the food is very reasonable too. Also, if you don't have time to wait for food, you can order ahead online. This place is just great! Support this business! You can't go wrong!

NObuQHBsguAUKv-Xc2PiFg.text: GO HERE! Biscuits and gravy are divine. The gravy was not thick and the biscuits were fluffy pillows of buttery goodness. Not tough at all! They make everything to order so it may take a few extra mins, but it is worth it. As all good things are.  Great back patio with misters, greenery, and plenty of seating. One of my new favorite spots!

QfnLPuJqzOMChaSPYi7qiA.text: Ordered Togo this morning.... Best decaf americano ever, without the judgey 'ew decaf' looks. (I'm pregnant so decaf is temporarily acceptable). Ordered the delicious ricotta pancakes. Pancakes came with whipped butter and syrup plus a tart mixed fruit compote. Excellent way to start my Saturday.

fgW00zFozFR-1eqqXVXqkw.text: Love this place!  The decor is simple and so shabby chic.  The staff is amazingly friendly and welcoming.  And, the food was just incredible - quality, fresh ingredients mixed together to be so flavorful and tasty.  The sandwiches were so good - meatloaf and ham and next time I'll try one of the side salads too.  The bakery case looked incredible, but we showed some restraint this time, but maybe not next time!

71La_WAvxyMVmvFSx5qt9A.text: Went to Ollie Vaughn's for the first time today.  You order at the counter and when you are done you bus your own dishes, but that is fine with me.   My husband and I each ordered a sandwich and shared, so I had half the tuna sandwich and half the chicken salad sandwich.  The tuna was pretty tasty with a great jalapeno sauce to spice things up.  I wouldn't call the chicken salad sandwich a chicken salad, it was like thinly sliced deli meat piled up and had a couple pieces of jicama and a tomato.  It really needed some moisture and some seasoning because it was pretty bland.  I will say they do provide a generous amount of filling in each sandwich, so you weren't eating mostly bread with each bite.  I had black tea with blueberry, it really tasted off - I thought it tasted like detergent, but since my sandwich was dry I sipped it anyways.  When my husband brought back a glass of water it also had that detergent taste, that explains the problem with the tea.  Doesn't anyone else taste it?? Some filtered water for brewing the tea would make a world of difference. It seemed like a good deal of the other reviews were for breakfast items which I have not tried, so maybe that would make a difference, but for lunch I was not impressed enough to come back.

RHet8jvSqx7xwNwowXg91Q.text: Very enjoyable experience...been going here for a few months and I think the breakfast sandwich and cold brew toddy is all I need :) one of these days I will try some other things on the menu. Love it here :). Thanks

Cp2oE4BHmfTlgFKydR3oeg.text: Ordered the breakfast sandwich on a biscuit. Asked for cheddar, they gave me gruyere. Which I hate. Also no veggies like it said on the menu. The biscuit fell apart, but it was good and I'm sure they would have fixed the sandwich but we were in a hurry to go to work. Lemon bar a little too tart, quiche was good, good crust.

o563gFnPYk3-U2u_f2xg0Q.text: This place rocks!! The pastries are amazing!! The cinnamon roll is the best one I've ever had (I've had my fair share). The breakfast menu is all amazing, the sandwiches are delicious with ingredients that I would never have thought to combine but work so well together. All around great place to eat.

GdjeD9QyCN-0CuPRhVMsfg.text: Nice, hip, calm atmosphere w some plant life and covered patio out back.   Was in the area (not my part of town) and stopped to get a coffee before work. Great place!

-UHhEb0fKP50iqjzkbzv-g.text: My favorite spot for coffee, breakfast and lunch. Everyone who works here is super nice and seems genuinely interested in their job. The food is always fresh and pretty and delicious. The best.

-0gb02covBaFVbPj4esX3g.text: What a neat little place. Sandwiches, salads, desserts, and breakfast items. I had the ham on marbled rye and my husband had ham on sourdough. My kids had bacon, eggs and sourdough toast. We would visit again if we were in the area and needing lunch.

CKR1VR-bWYgyk43yiZ1BaQ.text: Extremely delicious, fresh, high-quality food. Atmosphere is low-key and way less pretentious than Lux. Reasonable prices. Lovely, quiet patio. I love it all.

52O949piaZ3_ccilZExVVg.text: What a cute little local place!  Everything I have tried has been wonderful,  but the corn salad is my very favorite followed by the peanut butter kiss cookies (to die for) . The service is a little slow sometimes due to only one or 2 people cooking, but if you are in a rush, call it in or order on line.

i8ExXLJ0d1DGOL0qbP0F5A.text: One of the best steak sandwiches on marble rye I have ever consumed. A delight to eat in or take out.

aVqpZS5DhgHIwvRewaOtcQ.text: I've been here a few time for breakfast and once for lunch.  Excellent every time.  But my new thing is I discovered their Ham and Cheese Croissants.  So now I have their phone number on my speed dial.  Call it it every morning and I am in and out in a few mins. Love this place.

yeAaw4MhINcJF5s6bl3ytg.text: I drove by this place for a long time not thinking to try it because the building looks so dumpy on the outside, but then a friend told me that they had the best croissants.  I finally tried it and I have to say all of the food I've had there has been great, although my favorites are the ham and cheese croissant (the best I ever had), the coconut cream pie and the carrot cake.  Everything is made fresh and in small quantities so it tastes like something you would get from your Mom's kitchen.   The interior is comfortable and they have a nice patio area outside.  Hours are a little limited......just don't expect to go there in the evening because it closes at 3pm.

CWv02Dkd8kiwmMHzzNZxXg.text: AH-MAZING! Ambience is great but the food is even better!! We got the breakfast sandwich and the grilled cheese and I'm officially in love. Another great addition to the Coronado Historic District. Check it out!

gBwYLowXAPr5yFnh0Av6fg.text: Stumbled upon this place accidentally and it is the cutest little shop. So far I've just had their coffee, but all of the baked goods look amazing. Super friendly staff and great atmosphere. TBH the aesthetic of this place is on point.

eNrnE__acIvnZnUWHjlKeA.text: Great spot to find in my new neighborhood.  The croissant breakfast sandwich is so darn delish and cheap!  I almost wish she would have charged me more so that I can help ensure this spot doesn't go away!  Support this place! Great food and awesome space and service!
