The prices are fair but I would like to try something new since the sandwich didn't knock my socks off. Desserts were the same had a lemon bar which was like I said good but nothing spectacular. Looking forward to trying other menu items. Thank you!

cPdXP1RXV0E7HGGtaoHHvQ.text: I've been coming to Ollie's for a while, but things are really going downhill the last couple of months. They can't seem to get an order right any more. Today I left after receiving half of my order. I literally didn't have the energy or desire to correct them once again. Sorry Ollie's, but we are done. This place has all the red flags of a once was great place that is about to close.

D1mo4JwNcbvJ4PR3cTXugw.text: This is what I have been looking for!!!! Family owned & operated perfect decor and of course incredible food.

hMsdjEHgZrK0NNOz586QOQ.text: Right next to my favorite hair salon, Hair Pollution (which is unfortunately closing in a few weeks!).  Very cute space, good flow, open area in the back with shade and a small vertical garden is simply delightful.  Smelled like bacon the moment I stepped foot inside. Yum.  Ordered a lavender green tea, two oatmeal cookies with buttercream frosting in between, and a small corn salad.  Real ingredients. The buttercream is to die for. Really delicious and buttery cookie. Fresh and cool corn salad with avocado and peppers. I love that they have a small portion for $3.50 (the portion is just called small, it actually isn't very small and was very filling)  Will go again. Looked like a chill spot to study.

qKhHvH9iMZnO3zJ6Mo0ZsA.text: Hidden cool spot.  Food and ambiance consistently excellent.  Like the simplistic approach but portions a bit dainty.  Black coffee works here.

oXte_FuVc-Vm95AqbkypJg.text: A very unassuming place in the Coronado district that delivered on taste and quality! We ordered the pork chill verde, hash browns, eggs, French toast and both hot and iced chai lattes. Wow. The eggs taste like they're from farm raised chickens, the biscuits were definitely made from scratch but not heavy, the hash browns were seasoned and cooked to perfection (not overly cooked outside and undercooked inside), the French toast with maple syrup and compote (strawberry/pineapple) was so good, thick slices but light, and the chai was packed with spices and full of flavor. We most certainly will be back for the good quality and the ambiance was pleasant as well. The only downside was their Apple Pay wasn't working. I like using it when I can. But that would not at all deter me from this place or highly recommending others patron the business with regularity.

zbprSJs3AvPwda1MSN-OFw.text: Decent sandwich but crazy slow and poor customer service. Just needed 3 sandwiches to go and literally took 15 min with no explanation nor apology. Went because of high Yelp marks but not always a good indicator.

gKG9iROCwys0_BxldUbkyg.text: Love it! Best little lunch spot. Not a huge selection, but it will be your favorite sandwich so you want to go back every week for another! The tuna and the meatloaf are my favorites. It has a lovely atmosphere with a fabulous owner. The only issue is that she makes too many delicious treats and you can't pick which one to get!

RkHr9FZ2jtRyQWr76EPEwA.text: What kind of cute breakfast place is closed on a Sunday? I want to share a nice breakfast with my wife when we are not running around trying to get to work

xBkNw76GUKrUCPWifuo9HA.text: Meh...I've been here a few times over the past year; always hoping I will finally experience that 5 star experience that so many others have enjoyed.  Sadly after my most recent experience I won't be returning.  Friendly staff...not today; actually they always seem uninterested!  Great food...not today either.  Granted I think they use quality ingredients but it just doesn't translate visually or in taste.  Value...overpriced for the amount they serve you...as many others have mentioned in earlier reviews.   Hairnets, or lack there of...isn't that a health violation?  Who does that?  It's an open kitchen people....everyone can see what's going on in there.  Seriously, bearded guys preparing my food without a hair net is inexcusable not to mention the women and men without hats or hairnets slinging hash as well.  Time to check their inspection reports.  Heck, even Costco takes food preparation more seriously than this Mom & Pop place.  Pluses and there are some.  Ambience...it's hip and urban on the fringe of a really cool neighborhood.  Awesome patio...YES it's really as nice as everyone says it is.  Now if they could just improve on the important stuff - customer service, great tasting food and kitchen hygiene.  Sorry guys...I tried to love you and I wanted too so much.  But I just can't.

0aeL-XbUxiHxOKziGNA4dg.text: Great lattes.  Awesome baked goods prepared in store.   Try the pork chile verde (picture an individual pot pie tipped by a homemade biscuit) and the lemon ricotta pancakes - light and fluffy served with fresh berries.   Friendly staff and nice local coffee shop atmosphere.

bjN3B0pxt2A0fskFHTNITw.text: I came to get some breakfast--got there at 9:45AM. I ordered the pork chile verde and some orange juice. The dish was supposed to come with a biscuit but they ran out so they offered to use a croissant instead, which I agreed to and it was still very good. The people were very nice, the space was clean, and the juice pretty good, too, although I finished my OJ in 15 minutes and didn't get my food until 10:45. The reason for giving it three stars was because the wait was unbearably long. Nearly an hour of just sitting at a table to get my food...I think the person who was in line behind me ended up just straight up leaving because of the wait.

MoJSfnq1mjyUAyKhUHCVwQ.text: Very cute decor, vintage feel, but I hate walking into a place that reeks of bacon. Wanted to leave immediately after I walked in. The guys behind the counter were very nice. I quickly ordered the blue lady iced tea which is a black tea with a hint of blueberry---yum! I took an oatmeal pie (think Little Debbie) to go which was just ok. If I came back I would definitely opt to sit on the back patio which has cute repurposed decorations.

r8pO-cQNqMj33T33YqYXAQ.text: Would give it a 5 for the awesome food, but giving the restaurant a 3 for customer service.

ZlPIP6f60Z38UCdbg8YLCw.text: Nice place for casual breakfast.   Coffee was strong and full bodied.   Very good.   Ordered the pork verde.    It was delicious but a bit dry for my taste.    Needed some sour cream or Verde gravy to enhance flavor.    The biscuit that came with it was delicious.     Service was quick and friendly.

b9v18gAThBojp3if0P-3Vg.text: Ollie Vaughn's is a great lesser known spot for coffee, tea and lite fare like salads and sandwiches.   I've been impressed every time with their baked goods, and this time was no different. I got the peanut butter and jelly cream pie, and it was exceptional. A good, flakey pie crust is a lost art these days, but OV comes through with a crust flakier than a politicians campaign promise. This pie was sweet without being cloying and had a taste pleasantly reminiscent of elementary school brown baggin it with yo PBJ.   Outside a baked goods, OV's delivers on great quality sandwiches and salads, priced more reasonably than most.

Tu4aNdbPTgd9lElNTObUGw.text: Great hole in the wall. Had a Chili Verde breakfast bowl that was a rather magnificent way to dine after coming in on a flight early in the morning.  The pork was pretty much perfect, with just enough fat for that authentic taste with a nice biscuit and sunny side egg thrown in for good measure.  Good service and millennial cool.  Thumbs up for breaky!

SD2IC4OqywOvjTCTTJ33PA.text: Found this spot on AZ central's best breakfast article and it did not disappoint! You can tell it's a small operation but puts out big results. We had the poppyseed pancakes and biscuit and gravy and both were delicious! Super affordable and portion sizes were enough to feed you but not make you feel super full. I loved the atmosphere; we sat outside and it was clean and relaxing. I was most impressed when I asked for a to-go cup for my coffee and the man offered to pour us fresh new cups to go. I will absolutely be back to try their other items!

DQtNHmJyQrStJtSK-rPqxA.text: This cafe is pretty close to work so I decided to try it one day for a quick bite during my late lunch hour, around 2 pm. I tried ordering a couple of different things, including one of their soups and a sandwich, but by this time, they already ran out. So I had to settle on a different sandwich and an iced tea. My friend and I's order took a while to come out even though we both just ordered simple sandwiches (the same exact kind) - about 25 minutes? For a cafe, and for it not being on rush hour, I thought this wait time was pretty outrageous. The food was mediocre and I didn't find anything special with the drink.  I can see myself returning here just for a quick coffee, but probably not for food or a bite.   Parking is on the side of the building, also facing McDowell St.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

27jktTnDZhf6LJ1B2KqYjA.text: Cozy, comfort food & atmosphere. If you are looking for biscuits & gravy, this is the place for it in Phoenix. (We've tried a lot!) If we lived in the neighborhood, we would definitely be regulars.

WsIuawvc2L4xLrCmSOW83A.text: I stopped in here to get a coffee and was craving a dessert for weeks. What an incredible array of highest quality, crafted desserts. My pecan square was outstanding.  Rich, not sugary, decadent, didn't give me a sugar hang-over.  The coffee blend was also incredible for my liking!  I will go out of my way to get here whenever I get the desire for a sweet.  I wish this was in my neighborhood. I'd be a regular.  Worth an extra 5-10 minutes to drive here if you want quality and integrity!!

CHCD_ezPXlSYEf_k5szvXQ.text: Unpretentious coffee shop, bakery, and lunch joint. Got the chicken salad sandwich with a small side of cous cous and a black ice tea. One of the best iced teas I've had, cous cous was refreshing, sandwich was tasty. Open kitchen allows you to see what's cooking behind the scenes, nice back patio, covered, shaded, and green. Cool vibe overall after going to the overly pretentious, overly priced, overly homogeneously populated Lux.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2jsn7mj8fZLRgCaJC9Xtog.text: Best food at a reasonable price! Love the breakfast options. Not a huge fan of the salads, but they are really inexpensive! The chicken sandwich is amazing with the green chilies. The ambiance is casual, friendly & inviting. The patio out back is super cute too.

1qSWhKiOfsPbrutW0Wp0bQ.text: This place is absolutely amazing and I eat hear about 3x a week. Coming from New York, this is the closest bacon egg & cheese you will get thats priced perfectly and tasted amazing. It's also perfect to have meetings because the food caters to everyone and their pastries are on point. Best place on McDowell RD. in Phoenix for breakfast hands down.

Rt1yLuvUlvJlqnW5uJl1Kw.text: Ollie Vaughn's is a downtown staple with a really chill vibe. The food is amazing! Defiantly recommend for breakfast and lunch! Their pork verde is my favorite!

qRj4G94v1wC4O24ydIgPJw.text: Love this little neighborhood gem!  The build your own breakfast sandwich is SO good, making it a challenge to try anything else :)  The croissants are the best I've ever had.  Cute atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious food.. can't go wrong.

DIxs9S-G-338DmbqQ7deSg.text: Good pastries, but everything else is lackluster. It takes forever to get your food, then when it does you don't get a lot. You won't leave this place on a happy stomach. You also won't leave with a happy wallet. Their prices are higher than IHOP for the same quality food and less of it. You might like this place if you like everything over cooked. My wife's croissant was practically burnt and my hash browns and sausage were too crispy. I also have serious questions about how they clean their equipment. My eggs tasted like it was cooked on a stove that had just been used to cook someone else's food. Definitely won't be back, but take this with a grain of salt, this is only based off of three visits to their cafe with consistently the same experience.

pT6eJk-V3JOaQe4d5O60vQ.text: What's not to like about this place! The food is fresh, good coffee and they even have a little play house that kept my toddler entertained. They have nice outdoor seating area. I had the chicken sandwich and a white mocha. Glad they're nearby.

9XnO0wvo_2Dinkqzd2oqrA.text: Food is usually good, albeit pricy and usually small portions. I had to have them reheat my food twice and ask for my drink again since they forgot to make it. It's more cafe then restaurant, so other than bringing food out, you need to get your own silverware and wait for your drink and are expected to bus your table (which is fine but not sure warrants a default 20% tip, especially when it was my first couple of times and they dropped off the food and I asked if I could get a fork/napkins and they said you can grab them inside...not great service since I was alone and didn't want to leave my food/stuff exposed by itself). You can easily spend $15-20 here per person.

ZBymk9HHf1-Jim3AuSrHvA.text: Found this little gem by accident and I will tell you that you need to get here and have breakfast.  The best biscuits and gravy I've had in Arizona. And all of there breads pastry's and quiche is homemade and the dread for sandwiches is from wildflower bakery.  This is a True diamond in the rough you would drive by and never know it was here.  Try it you'll agree best breakfast in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Xu1dDMkEYq4O32DMVyo4hw.text: Wow! What a great establishment. The food is unbelievably delicious. I had the breakfast sandwich on sourdough (add the veggies) and it was one of the best I've had. The staff are EXTREMELY friendly and went out of their way to provide an extra level of customer service. On top of it, they really seemed to enjoy working there. Highly recommend sitting on the patio in the back. There's a cute orchard and a few tables for the few lucky enough to get here before a line forms. Can't wait to come back!

K3YpfXicgUjQwSD1n1EqUA.text: 5 stars! The food is absolutely delicious! They made everything fresh and you can watch them with the open kitchen. Cool vibe and ambience. We had the pork Chile Verde and The breakfast sandwich on the croissant. Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Sandwich &amp; Pork Chile Verde. 5 stars!

jdAozwirAbpTWxykddSh9g.text: You should come for the food and tea and not so much the coffee. We came to visit a few days and did not expect such a rough exterior, but when we walked in, everything was all good. The restaurant was quite inviting and the employee that greeted us was nice. We had to order at the counter and so we ordered a breakfast sandwich: scrambled eggs, bacon, cheddar, arugula and avocado on a croissant. We also ordered the ricotta pancakes, a lavender green tea for myself and hubby ordered an iced vanilla latte.   I enjoyed my green tea and drank every drop, but my hubby couldn't even drink a fraction of the coffee and he's a coffee addict. He told me to try it and it tasted like watered down, barely any taste coffee- yuck. So that left a sour taste in our mouths as a start...  We get our food and I liked the sandwich- the croissant had a perfect crunch and we practically ate it in seconds. The ricotta pancakes were ok- they weren't bad, but nothing about the taste stood out to me.   Overall, I would come back. I'm just not sure if my hubby would join me since he was so upset that his coffee was so bad and he had to throw it away.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast Sandwich/Ricotta Pancakes

iXtAnploRPErQ_SacTMkVQ.text: They have the best Mexican wedding cookies I've ever tasted. French toast and lox bagel were also very good.

Xguhj9jyFa04QRFuQsaE1g.text: Excellent neighborhood addition! Love coming here for breakfast and coffee on the weekends with my pup! They have a dog friendly patio, which I always enjoy! I really enjoy their almond milk caramel latte and they have scrumptious pastries available every morning! The prices are great and the staff is always super friendly.

c0XcGRUWeH2ccNDApQSAWA.text: Finally stopped in to this adorable new place. Central Phoenix has another great coffeehouse, yay! I particularly enjoyed the cinnamon roll, which was a buttery, flaky, croissant-like masterpiece.   The interior is bright and comfortable. Lots of outlets if needed. There is a cute patio in back. Support these guys!

LSbPByNNsouddRUdHTol6g.text: This cute little place has tasty sandwiches and delish tea! This is a great hidden gem in the hood that will surprise you when you walk in. It has quaint character and when it's cool outsude the patio is so relaxing. I love to grab lunch here and enjoy the homemade and fresh food!

3jo2hBwvYVpmgC9M7a4p1Q.text: I was so excited to see this cute place open up SO close to my house! It is definitely improving the neighborhood. Super cute inside, and a nice back patio, with vegetable gardens! The salads are super healthy and contain all a vegetable lovers favorite ingredients- kale, brussel sprouts, watermelon radishes, quinoa, etc. Sandwiches and soups are also healthy and really delicious, and every meal comes with a free little cookie or other sweet for dessert! Can't wait to try everything on the menu.    My only recommendation for the owners would be to get an espresso machine. Then I'll never have to go anywhere else.

NPWgRW2jyatnYo_H1WH6fA.text: I order my breakfast online here & the process is so easy & efficient. The confirmation emails letting you know about the time your order will be ready are MAJOR KEY for me, since I have to clock out for a quick 15 min. break to go pick it up. I work right down the street from this place & every time I've ordered I've never had problems. There's a cook there & I don't know his name, but he is so prompt & the sweetest. He has always been at the ready for whatever you need, and pays close attention to customer needs. I LOVE the food. Every time I try something new I fall in love. It's a cute little spot, with a home-type feel. Try the Corn Salad; it's a little piece of heaven. Awesome lunch/brunch/breakfast spot for sure!

2vRI5bCvWujeviBCgmZx3w.text: Their lemon bars are gigantic!  And only 3.50!  It helped make up for the "large" $8 salad that was pretty much overpowered by bacon.  I love bacon, but damn!  I think for an $8 salad it needs to have more stuff in it that you can taste, besides the bacon.  Plus the container's only half full so it's like a cup and a half of salad that you get for $8.  I think I'll try some of their other offerings and update the review but I was sorely disappointed with the salad.

hlVaIHL02Wj-EZkeI02RgQ.text: Ollie Vaughn's is the kind of place where you taste the food and you realize most of the other places you gave 4 or 5 stars on yelp need downgraded. I only go for the breakfast items, but everything I've had really is that good.

9SLZnxXESH_YaWGlWpti1g.text: Too hot to turn on your oven and bake? No problem. Go to Ollie Vaughn's. You can't bake nearly as well as they can, anyway. We go for breakfast, lunch , afternoon snack (lemonade and a cookie). It's always fresh and flaky (the baked goods) and you get to watch them bake stuff. Put this on your list.

tVIweg54mTqAyhydfKTsog.text: Amazing!!! Had the breakfast sandwich croissant which was savory and croissant had the perfect balance of soft and crunchy. Doesn't like much of a place from outside, but it is cute, charming and a hidden gem.

_UoExBqFSWLBL29LNWogkQ.text: Ollie's has the best sandwiches and baked goods in town! Friendly service and a cozy, welcoming atmosphere! They use the freshest local ingredients and the result is creative and inspiring food that tastes amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken salad sandwich, lemon bar, and lemonade!

QW9pVFi6LWB9NJEcWFxYbQ.text: What to drink: the iced toddy -- it's one of the best I've ever had  What to eat: the breakfast sandwich, it's completely customizable but I got a biscuit with bacon, Gruyere cheese, avocado and an over medium egg.The biscuit is what sets it a part from over breakfast sandwiches I've had, probably because they specialize in their pastries.  I only stopped by for a bit on my way to work, but they have an awesome playlist and some nice seating (inside and outside). If you're looking for an escape from some of the overcrowded coffee shops like Giant Coffee or Lux, I would definitely try working out of Ollie Vaugh's.

5BcTFJvoequf7B8GDOWrQA.text: I visited last week for the first time. Found it here on yelp when I was looking for a nearby spot for some breakfast. It had very good reviews, so I tried it out. I prefer independent, mom and pop type places over the big chains.   I like the look and feel of the place--very hipster. I ordered the chili pork over a biscuit, topped with egg sunnyside up... I sat down and waited while they prepared my food. First thing I noticed was that everyone was involved in the kitchen area, as it was a small setup.. Only one person working there was wearing any kind of hair restraint. The main person doing most of the cooking was not wearing a cap or hairnet.. And, to top it off, no one was wearing gloves or washing their hands. I noticed the main cook go up to the cash register to wait on a customer, handle the person's money, then go right back to cooking without washing his hands. And he was directly handing raw food at the time.  To make matters worse, when my food arrived, the egg I had ordered sunnyside up had the yolk 3/4 cooked and it was sealed up tight like the egg was basted instead of sunnyside up.. The purpose of ordering a sunnyside up egg on a dish like this is to have the velvety yolk make a sauce of sorts on the dish.  I sent the store an online message thru their websites "contact us" link, but after one week,have heard nothing back. I believe everyone deserves a chance. No place is perfect and everyone has a bad day. But for them to have some GLARING health department issues and some basic cooking issues and not respond to a sincere guest letter with honest feedback says alot about the place..   I say Stay away if you value your safety

3nHTUdBo-69FmrJTAs_EBg.text: I love this place!! In such a random place but the food is awesome. And their carrot cake is the best I've ever had.The breakfast sandwich is amazing. Get it on a croissant with avocado, red peppers, green chilis, and bacon. You can thank me later.

c0vZUKOMXKzifvf7V7mRJw.text: My client took me here to eat lunch with 2 other coworkers. 3 of us had the the tuna sandwich and wow it was amazing!!!! It had this jalapeno jelly. It sounds nasty but it was the best tasting jam that I ever had lol. I usually don't like jam at all but this was so good. The tea I got was lavender and I let I didn't like it as much because it was odd bitter taste. My coworker liked it though.  The environment was cozy,  bright, and comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KKcnZKYzL8Gj6d--hMureQ.text: This place deserves every bit of its 5-Star Reviews. The service is friendly and updated, the ambience is quaint and cozy, and the food is quite possibly some of the best lunch-time fare I've had in Phoenix, especially in the area.  I got the chicken-salad sandwich on Brioche, and it was evenly proportioned and prepared perfectly. My favorite little touch was the powdered sugar-dusted no-bake cookie that they included. My only regret is that I didn't find it sooner...

LRdPvsA_yJ7iQxTbKJxNxw.text: So good so friendly   amazing attention to details  had chicken salad on toasted brioche

RLjpHBh3pgs-Dbf03mYUew.text: We first came here on Mother's Day and were so pleasantly surprised. But often on subsequent visits, a place can disappoint. But NOT Ollie Vaughn's! Every time we come, the food is lovingly prepared and totally delicious!! It is our new favorite weekend breakfast place. Our only hesitation in writing this review is that it will bring more fans to this surprise treasure on McDowell!

6IrKIZODeDVXhW40NfGdyA.text: My first visit to Ollie Vaughn's and I know I will be back again soon. Had the pork green chilli. WOW! Delicious tender pork on a buttermilk biscuit and a fried egg on top. Tender and delicious and the buttermilk biscuit soaked up some of the pork juices and was outstanding. Really a cute restaurant with good food and healthy portions. I was to full for a dessert but did manage to have a bite of the chocolate cake with vanilla frosting.YUM! Should have saved room for dessert. Next time I will be sure to take one home if I don't have room after the meal.  They will be adding some new coffee options soon. Afternoon coffee and dessert anyone?  Friendly staff, great food and welcoming atmosphere. You won't be disappointed!

Y5pNXO_uQdu4OH6woFhKcw.text: I have thoroughly enjoyed EVERYTHING I've had on their menu. Their menu is simple and the food is creative. ANYTHING you try will impress your tastebuds! My favorite? Biscuits and Gravy with a fried egg on top. Their cookies are out of this world! The pies are unique and delicious! I love the ginger pear pie served warm with ice cream!!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3WW0BVQPydj7dQ18B7bcwA.text: FINALLY made it to this little spot just a short walk from my house. Ordered online for pick-up over my lunch hour. Easy and super convenient as I go home most days for lunch - this right by my house. Food was ready at the time they indicated under the 'Order Now' option. I went with the Veggie sandwich on multi-grain and the Cuban sandwich on sourdough. The veggie was really tasty, the chickpea puree was the perfect 'meat,' and the multi-grain was chewy and delish. My other half had the Cuban, which I surprised him without telling him what it was - the man said he could eat them everyday and wanted to know why I hadn't introduced him to that place sooner!  We're both looking froward to trying the breakfast and coffee. I'm giving it five stars. Happy all around. Glad Ollie Vaughn's is in my neighborhood - we love to support our local businesses.

KntB7uQPPwBczliLkUxxcg.text: What's not to love about Ollie Vaughn's? Great coffee, tasty food, dog friendly patio, unpretentious vibe, wifi, and a neighborhood hangout where everybody knows your name. Lindsay Magee does it right. First-timer? No worries. You'll fit right in! Run, don't walk to OV's!

hd6bmoJ0bBCgoEz81GWJ0w.text: Short version: This place is fantastic. Curb appeal is None, but once you go in you get why you decided to come here. It's cafe style; where you walk in, order, then can sit until your food is brought to you.   Long version: We absolutely loved this place. The service was spot on, the menu was super interesting with a variety of options that you would not completely expect from a coffee shop, but it is great. The atmosphere of the restaurant hits the nail on the head. It has a very cafe like feeling which is exactly what the goal was. There is also outdoor seating as well (110 degrees when we swung through so we opted to stay inside). When it came to the actual food, they cooked it spot on. I built my own sandwich upon my order which was pretty basic (eggs over easy, cheese, and sausage), but they nailed it when actually making the meal. It came out fairly quick; and it was perfect. My Ice Vanilla Latte was also spot on perfect too. In all, if you're in the area, highly recommend stopping by!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Latte &amp; Breakfast Sandwich

huWGoSwZWdsO2FlaVymqIg.text: You know....sometimes... I was aced out of three tables today by people who hadn't even ordered. I was so frustrated! I had to take our food to go ultimately. It makes me not want to come back here. This review will either spur more people to grab a table early or inspire the management to reward politeness by actually managing the clientele.   Food is always good.

xvDPsxEK93gLNWQ98S7cZA.text: Ollie Vaughn's is a tiny breakfast/lunch joint that offers some mostly straightforward brunch food. And hey, it works. A simple menu with fair prices and well executed basics? I can't really complain.   Items such as ricotta pancakes, as well as a traditional American breakfast of eggs, bacon, and hash browns are all just fine. Their hash browns, in particular, have a nice crispy exterior and an interior that's almost creamy.  Their biscuits and gravy, a dish that I've felt few can actually get right, is actually one of the better versions you can find based on my experience. The biscuits are light and fluffy, with the gravy being equally as light and flavorful. This is a dish that I often avoid due to the heaviness it induces on the stomach, but I'd gladly order Ollie's biscuits and gravy a second or third time.   Coffee is also very good here. My girlfriend was quite pleased with both her latte (which was an accidental order), as well as their basic, traditional coffee.  There's an extensive offering of pastries here. More than you'd expect from such a tiny spot. I can't speak for their quality, but would definitely consider trying one on a return visit.  With so many breakfast options in Phoenix, including a list of established favorites, I'm not sure if I'd quite put Ollie Vaughn's into my regular brunch rotation. But this takes absolutely nothing away from their food, which is done quite well.   Recommended!

w_6zMODJdqtctyTpbD2itA.text: Initially I was planning on getting a sandwich somewhere, but my friends said I needed to try this spot. After agreeing to go, and enjoying my meal... it's been cemented in my mind that I have really good friends! We visited around 11:30am, and I thought they would be serving lunch or something..NO! They serve breakfast all day! And it's good!! Really good! One friend ordered the biscuits and gravy, another ordered a breakfast plate, and I ordered biscuit and chili Verde with an over easy egg. Everything was delicious and fantastic!! I'm blown away by how good it was!

WjdU50MOC7A6Ie3llvBX1A.text: Very limited breakfast menu, but oh man! The banana bread French toast was beyond yummy. Didn't need the walnuts, chocolate chips or whipped cream, but I ate every last bite! No need to get dessert, although their desert selections looked equally amazing.

BkyaaQYLoq-K9ipB_TyOig.text: I didn't have any expectations for our lunch here but it was really, really good! We were nearby so we decided to stop in and it was a great decision.   There's a gravel lot next to it for parking, but once you walk in you're transported into a hip little spot. Indoor and outdoor seating, good music, and smallish but tasty menu with breakfast and lunch options. They also have some baked goods and coffee if you want to go that route.   The three of us ordered the tuna salad sandwich on sourdough, the American breakfast, a side of fruit, and the chicken salad sandwich on wheat. We were all super pleased with or picks. I had the tuna and it was one of the better tuna salad sandwiches I have ever had. They add jalapeno marmalade which gives it a twist that's tasty and not too hot of a kick. I highly recommend!  I would definitely come back if I was nearby. Service was friendly too.

fGfjp3ggeycW7RA12ZNoFQ.text: Hidden treasure. Fantastic find delicious and fresh. All pastries pies made from scratch. Great vegan options. Can plug in at every table and work  staff is welcoming and helpful. Love this

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh peach vanilla bean cheesecake with a almond biscotti crust

vWj38hw9HUDCHZC5QMwWJw.text: Loooooved this place!  Amazing service, really great food and a nice spot for kids.    Had the soup, a breakfast sandwhich (croissant, egg, bacon, gruyere)and the ricotta pancakes.  Everything was soooo good, soooo good!  I definitely recommend and will be back with the hubs.   Little outside area is great for kids!

SFwSlBWvIH7gFgfLTPFr8w.text: Very nice spot to chill for breakfast and coffee. Very good coffee if you know what to order but the cashier was awesome at recommending what to order and more than willing to fix it if not satisfied. The pastries look so bomb so I will be back to try the rest but for now you can't go wrong with the ham and cheese croissant or cinnamon roll.

6cx_cLM6scr1fizOEhLjFg.text: This review is strictly based off of the desserts that my wife and I had. We had lunch prior and were looking for a place to get some sweets. We ordered the coconut cream pie and and oatmeal cookie sandwich pie. The oatmeal cookie was incredible. I loved the overall flavor of this dessert and would totally order it again. The coconut cream pie was amazing as well. Really delicious coconut flavor from the cream and the whipped cream topping was really good as well. Cold brew was pretty good too. I would definitely come back for the desserts and I would also like to try some of their breakfast options too.

OB3pqp4egJJg4tlABqR1Sg.text: Eclectic coffee shop, with a small bakery counter and limited breakfast and lunch menu. Cute place in the area east of Downtown. It is a popular place so have been wanting to check it out. I was catching a show nearby and stopped in today. I think I will need to make a return trip to get a better feel for the place. The folks working here were very friendly. They have a small patio out back.   These are the items I had and what I thought of them;    A house Latte- good, I downed it pretty quickly! Yum!  Avocado toast- A bit bland and nothing to write home about but, hey, it is Avocado toast. lol- maybe some cilantro on top might help?  Side sausage Patty- this was so delish and cooked to perfection. Nice and juicy. Yummy!  Mexican Wedding cookie to go which was eaten after show. I was not expecting too much since they tend to be dry but I was pleasantly surprised. On the drive home late at night when I popped it into my mouth I realized It was pretty much to die for. Teehee. I was told they make all their treaties in house. They all looked great. They had a Raspberry Cheesecake on display, banana bread and a few other items that looked pretty darn good. The servings were large enough for two people which is how the Mexican cookie came to be my pick for today. So the conclusion is that I will just have to definitely come back to try more of their cakes, pies, and cookies, and of course bring friends.   The only thing that was a bit off for me is that they ran out of what I really wanted to try and they do not have diet coke/products here.

buPxfl7WlQbOgqE3oRPN3g.text: This is our favorite little place for breakfast on the weekend.  Tasty food--quiche, croissants, pancakes, biscuits and gravy, french toast... yum.  The atmosphere is eclectic and relaxed.  A little outdoor courtyard in the back.  Fresh flowers on the tables.  We were concerned on a recent trip that they might not live up to our high expectations on a busy day when someone forgot our quiche in the oven and burnt it.  But they were immediately apologetic, refunding our money and quickly whipping us up some pancakes and eggs on the house.  Consistently friendly service keeps us coming back.

KPFk7KHOFoGUpdhAAz9RuA.text: Delicious food. Friendly staff. Beautiful outdoor seating. Only complaint is waiting 25 minutes for our food. Went on a Saturday at 11am.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast sandwich

VwaPUisw-tPxJXvRU5-7ng.text: Apparently this place has been in the neighborhood for years and I'm barely hearing about it...wtf is wrong with me?   I got myself the ricotta pancakes and man they were fire fire fire  They had this raspberry jam up for grabs so i got it. Woah. Talk about adding  gas to the fire   Their pastries looked good but I didn't want to get diabetes in a day so I'll wait to get them next time. I'll update my review then.

0FBIgCTFjoA9gzDmv85s_Q.text: Little pricey for what you get, but not bad. But the lemonade is a rip off. It's mostly ice. See the pic I got the bagel and lox. Top of the bagel was really burnt but the rest was soft. The salmon was average. The cream cheese was good.

R1qLxdaHUhEOfP3Lp0XHLg.text: Their croissants are one of the best I have ever had! Highly recommend their croissant breakfast sandwiches. They also have a nice array of pastries I hope to try in the future.

4jv4kCzSqdf0xLi9MHj0iA.text: Everything on this menu is da' bomb!  If you want some made from scratch breakfast foods and pastries, you won't be sorry.  I highly recommend the cheesecake and lemon bar if you want a sweet treat.  If you're in the mood for savory, try the pork chile verde with homemade biscuit or the build-your-own breakfast sandwich on a croissant (add the onions, arugula and chiles - yum)!  It's also fun to see all the cooks in the kitchen making all the yumminess!

NKHpb7qHUkEOPvmC5KqMjA.text: Never thought this was here out of all the times I had to come right next door to buy uniforms.. seriously a hidden gem.. it's small inside but have seating outside in the back.. the menu and drinks are very simple .. and they have a lot of pastries and desserts as well to choose from

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast with a side of bacon

9GFDkDBrWDbrD5CZVc_h-A.text: Loved this quaint coffee shop! After a friend recommended it, we knew we had to try it. They have homemade baked goods which we had to sample. An iced cinnamon bun for me and the pumpkin brownie for hubby. The brownie was too cold for my tastes. Hubby was fine with it. My cinnamon bun was large and I was glad to not have to share it. It was warmed up and served perfectly. Coffee was great with mine being a cappuccino. Hubby had his little Italian cup with pinkie in air as he sipped. Outside dog friendly patio. Cool interior. They also do breakfast and lunch. A must try for any coffee lovers out there

45FGhRlrIAVkIG9VGnubYA.text: First time at Ollie Vaughn's and I was not disappointed. They have a nice selection of pastries, all of which look amazing, and a menu of breakfast and lunch options. The coffee is smooth and served at a perfect drinking temperature. The layout is kind of an L shape going around the kitchen/coffee producing area. So think short and skinny with a few tables and around the corner to long and skinny with plenty of tables. They also have a fairly large outdoor space with shaded seating (shade is important in the desert). My preference is towards drip coffee which gives me confidence that they make a great latte or any other coffee based drink. I chose the almond pastry, she heated it for me, and it was awesome. Just sweet enough to handle the craving. Super friendly staff with a warm welcome. Can't wait to go back for breakfast!

O2Ovf3e7tpPY3D4-2S-jOA.text: Love love love! The owner is so awesome! I'm a picky eater and always requesting a few changes on the menu and they never turn me down! Baked items are fantastic! All handmade soups and baked goods. They uses top notch ingredients and the actual inside is set up so cute and clean! Huge back patio with fresh herbs and citrus tress. So cozy! Only thing they need is a espresso machine, but the tea and coffee they do have is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the Decor

kJI9E4eGAWyDlOgu296HCw.text: Adorable ambiance & quality food.  Lemonade is made from actual lemons, is really tart... and addictive! Their pastries are wonderful & the ingredients are legit.  I'd love longer hours & espresso... but, I know that may change what they are going for. And what they are is great!

fnEo_yQoUYwRPR7mdZF2Mg.text: Rapidly becoming one of my go to spots for a quick sandwich or breakfast.  The Chile Verde covered with an over easy egg is one of a kind, and all of the baked goods that I've tried thus far have been tasty to say the least.  One of the many gems that Coronado has to offer!  Try it yourself!

-sTDyB3AQKjEo247u-TfJQ.text: Love this place. Been here quite a few times and every time I go the food is great and the staff is awesome. The patio outback is nice and quiet. Highly recommend this place!!

ccQ0zH8tvPBzJgZRR06WCQ.text: This place ROCKS! Lunch date with one of my closest friends last week - and I suggested we go here. So glad she was game!  Between the two of us, there were three full meals (I also got a to-go order to have dinner at work.)  My lunch was the turkey sandwich on focaccia with stuffing, cranberry and bib lettuce, and a small spinach salad with lemon vinaigrette. Delish! Super fresh, perfect proportions and too much food! (I added the salad to my dinner bag - the sandwich was more than enough!) I also ordered a Mexican tea cookie, not realizing they were going to add a wonderful little chocolate peanut butter no bake cookie. Both were fantastic - and I was happy to have a friend there to share with!   Dinner was the flank steak sandwich on sourdough with the baby kale salad. Excellent quality, once again perfectly proportioned. I did eat both salads that night - and they were both absolutely fantastic. I also had the lemon bar on rosewater shortbread. Good thing I got a coworker to share that with me - I think I was already well over my calorie allotment for the day. And it was amazing!  Cute place, great back patio, excellent food. Not the cheapest sandwich in town - but given the quality, the value is definitely there.  The staff was all friendly, helpful and definitely made us feel welcome and valued.  Look forward to my next visit!

TlGgtifDuG9SdnXrI2uJdA.text: What a sweet little place. I work during their Monday through Friday hours, so I was finally able to check it out this last Saturday...the atmosphere is so refreshing and cheery, fresh flowers at every table and a lovely patio with garden in back.   I was in the mood for a light lunch: ordered the small quinoa salad and yogurt parfait. Fresh, tasty and simple, just what I was craving.  Next time I would like to try their coffee while sitting down to some writing, as the place just makes you want to stay awhile.

9pDwojpVE3Dp4A7nvUYH3A.text: I love this place.  Inside is modern, and really well-done, and the back patio is a great place to hang out on my computer with a pastry and a cup of coffee.  There's an herb garden back there and it's a great atmosphere.    The staff is always friendly, too.  I normally get the green tea (so good), and a sandwich - they're seasonal, and currently they have a veggie sandwich with asparagus, artichoke, and ricotta cheese on it.  I ask for it toasted, too, and it's awesome.  Their breakfast sandwiches are super-good, too.  I ask for mine to be covered in sausage gravy - because it's awesome, that's why.    Great place to check out - their pastries are super good.  Most times I'm in there and I can see them making it fresh.  The mixer is going and they're rolling out dough for stuff.  If I'm on my way home I sometimes grab one to go.

vFfgIV6DC6lWkWiq_0F11A.text: I love going to this place.  Called in an order today for 2 croissant breakfast sandwiches, one with sausage and one with bacon.  I added a few things this time, and I have to say the roasted tomatoes and peppers really add a nice touch.  Also got a chai tea latte. Seriously this place can do no wrong, everything was ready when we got there and cooked perfectly!  Thank you Ollie Vaughn's :)

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon croissant with gruyere cheese, scrambled eggs, roasted tomatoes and red peppers

SHii8zQ3bmL_ITCjIiEWzg.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch on the way to the airport. Service was very friendly and helpful, atmosphere was cute and had a nice patio. Try the Reuben and green lavender ice tea!  Yum!

SWWtuWisfVT0mIE7Q0xR1w.text: My friend recommended me to go here. Got the Cuban so good! It has prom chile verde in it! I am coming back to try the meatball sandwich, the winner of the 2015 Phoenix New Times. Really cute little place, they have more tables out in the patio outside in the back. Love the kisses (cookies). Def will come back!

bjquBc4jfWldc79u0BZbeg.text: Word on the street is that Ollie Vaughn's is a keeper.  Word on the street is RIGHT!  I've never been to Lux myself, but have heard all the praise and was intrigued when I heard their former baker opened a lunch shop in the Coronado 'hood.  Always skeptical of salads and sandwich fare, I decided to give it try.  The hubby decided to work from home on my birthday so that we could spend the day together, even if he spent his time on calls or the computer (which is just better because we share a car and I didn't have to drive him to and from work!).  So, I asked to go to Ollie Vaughn's for birthday lunch.  Away we went.  Grilled cheese for him (on brioche), ham sandwich for me (marbled rye) and split a large spinach salad.  Lavender green teas for both.  Ham sandwich was ridiculously good.  I think I still regret handing over my other half to my husband.  I got his grilled cheese in exchange.  It was very good and grilled to perfection (crunchy on the outside, oh yes), but I couldn't get past the mushrooms.  He loved it, but it wasn't quite the grilled cheese for me.  Which is fine, I loved the ham and want to try ALL the other sandwiches.  Now I sit at home sipping tea and enjoying some of a chocolate chip cookie and pumpkin spice tea bread.  The tea bread is so yummy (moist, flavorful, out of this world good).  The cookie is ok, but I'm a choc chip cookie snob.  It's way better than your average choc chip cookie.  I wanted to eat all the baked goods in the case.  The strawberry cheesecake, apple pie, raspberry chocolate scone, almond croissant, etc.  I will certainly be back.    AND the service is wonderful!  They have cookbooks out too to browse which I loved.  An avid cook and baker, those are my preferred reading material.

KkESXr83tuZNThy-M2452w.text: Best coffee you'll experience in Phoenix. I've tried just about every coffee house in Phoenix and Ollie Vaughn's is at the top in terms of quality tasting coffee. The atmosphere is also nice and staff is friendly. I'll travel 15 miles to simply enjoy a cup of their coffee.

fK1JbC3NTPmMpKYJWqeErg.text: Awesome little find in Central Phoenix!  Adorable interior and a very relaxed vibe, both with the employees and patrons.  Looked like they have a nice outdoor patio but I didn't check it out.    Ordered the biscuits and gravy and was slightly disappointed by how milky the gravy was but I am guessing they had to quickly make more gravy or extend the little bit of gravy they had left.  Other than being too milky it had really good flavor and the biscuits were friggin fantastic!  It was a good amount of food too!    Took a bite of my daughters croissant and it was delish!  Real croissant flaky numminess, not the crap you get from grocery stores.    Had lots of other yummy looking sandwiches and treats and I will definitely be back!

KZ3IzD-KBpQJKzVs7X0yVQ.text: Food was ok. Cute place. Meatloaf sandwich would be better with warm meatloaf and not cold. Won't be back because two cooks with long beards with no hair net. And one with no cap or hairnet. #healthcodeviolation

kpmhfbx8o3u4cCFNwWyUmw.text: Tucked away in an assuming location, Ollie Vaughn's is a delight.  Fresh flowers on the table make me smile.  A view into the clean and organized prep area keeps me intrigued and engaged.  Everything is hand-crafted and flavorful. I recommend the quiche and cookies.   I am excited about their upcoming cooking classes!

x8AVyvaGMgl9DlKES32vTg.text: Now, I'm not a violent person, but let's just say I would step on my beloved boyfriend's neck to get to their desserts. Lemon bars? Oh yeah...pie????? Oh heeeeeeells yeah!! Fresh, perfectly sweet and simply delightful.  Besides the yummy tasty treats, we also enjoyed a couple of their breakfast items. Their French toast with a berry compote is two little slices of heaven. Do not get me started on their bacon...bacon dot YEAH!!!!   I can't wait to go here again to sample many more of their dishes. We'll probably go so often it will be like Cheers up in that piece...NORM!!!

gNNEqez05422OYg9_ecg_g.text: I love this dog friendly place for both breakfast and lunch. Favorites include the pork verde with an over easy egg or the tuna fish sandwich. Make sure to have a latte with one of their amazing baked goodies for desert!

upry7DSkSjxREVlNjgnAWA.text: I absolutely love this place when I'm in phoenix. I love supporting local business and the food is delightful! I had a veggie sandwich and an iced coffee. The iced coffee was honestly the best I've had in a very long time. My sandwich was made with fresh ingredients and incredibly scrumptious. Overall I love this place. I love the vibe when you walk in and how kind the women working there are. I know next time I'm in Phoenix I'll definitely go there again.

kW0Thoo5OeQ8vQ-zlQ4t_Q.text: I'm giving this place 5 stars because I like the place, the owner, and I want to see this side of McDowell revitalized. The food is homemade and high-quality.   Suggestion to owner: put down candles and be open for dinner. I would come here all the time (walking distance). Or least stay open later (7pm).

03tco-rSGq0JIxN1eiVN1g.text: I went in there for lunch and was mildy disappointed.  I ordered the tuna sandwich on sourdough, which came with a typical bag of chips.  The sourdough seemed store bought, but the flavors on the sanwich were pretty good.  The presentation was terrible  - paper lined plastic baskets.  I also was tempted by the homemade oatmeal creampie cookies, but once again I was disappointed.  The cookies were in a cooler, and as a result the filling was rock hard.  It was also too buttery and made me feel like I ate an entire stick of butter.  They need to fill each cookie fresh as ordered and use approximately 1/2 as much filling.  I would also add a little more sweetness to fhe filling.  You should be able to pull apart the cookies or rip it in half, but the refrigeration prevents that.   The setting is nice, but the staff seemed overwhelmed for a reltively slow day.  There were only 2 parties there when we arrived. Right when we walked in the cashier told us that they could only take cards, but when we tried to use a card the machine froze.  He then said that we could pay in cash, which we did.  I also found the service to be very slow.  It took about 20 minutes for 2 cold sandwhiches.  I will probably go again, but it won't become part of my regular lunch rotation.

t8rqmb4n3sQ7JnjkPoLeWA.text: Took my dad here for breakfast after he helped my family move. We grabbed some great food while waiting for the rest of the family to arrive at the airport.   Everything was cooked fresh and the pastries were all amazing. When we are in that area again it is a definite stop.

mjtp0eFPbnJAkGgNb88YZg.text: My partner and I had that certain hankering from breakfast fare and we found ourselves at Ollie Vaughn's. The location is central and a beautiful addition to an otherwise run down strip mall. The interior design is smart, a mix of industrial and farmhouse-chic. Overall the space is sunny and welcoming.  As we waited in line to order we began to drool over the luscious pastries on display. They have a nice selection of fresh baked specialities including moon pies, lemon tarts, giant turtle brownies and almond croissants. To share we ordered a colossal slice of carrot cake, a mini oatmeal moon pie, earl grey tea and lemon poppyseed ricotta pancakes (on the special board). The gentlemen who assisted us was very polite and attentive.   We were promptly served the tea and carrot cake. The tea was superbly spicy and paired well with the fluffy, creamy super sweet goodness of the carrot cake. Even though it was by no means busy there was quite a wait for the pancakes. When they were finally delivered it was well worth the wait! We got three giant pancakes covered with fresh fruit and butter. The flavor was out of this world! Very lemony and tangy. Definitely crave worthy! Also, we had to remind them about the the oatmeal moon pie we ordered as it appears it was forgotten. They made up for the delay/faux pas by offering up a delicious chocolate and peanut butter moon pie, a new recipe they were trying out, which was like a crunchy yet whipped peanut butter orgasm for the mouth.  Overall everything was super delicious and our experience was memorable. However, it all was only one note in a symphony of flavor potential. The pancakes would have been elevated with a savory, meaty side dish. Perfectly crispy side of bacon, anyone? I hope they expand their menu to include more items. Also, what's with the hours? Please stay open later so we can enjoy you more!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The BEST carrot cake ever! Rich frosting, sweet carrots and chopped nuts as a garnish. YUM!
Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal moon pie and chocolate peanut butter experimental yumminess!

gF59ke8EOazCvDGY6ft2lw.text: 1st time here and the food was delicious!! The roasted tomato soup is amazing! Cuban sandwich was delicious. Definitely will be back to enjoy the cute patio.

3p0GFvEmh2GCZHq-CTQT3Q.text: I am beyond PISSED at myself for taking so long to find this gem!! I work 3min away from this place and I'm so happy to have found it. Breakfast plates are so good & their sandwiches are amazing as well. Haven't tried the coffee here yet but it looks just as good. Now I'm here 2-3 times a week at least.  Currently typing this review as I eat one of their Turkey sandwiches (which I highly recommend btw.)  Don't let the surroundings scare you away because this place is awesome!!

azeTNFfwHoZnqSt02gFtBQ.text: Gosh I hate to be the one to do this but, this was not even near 5 star caliber to me (especially comparing to other cafes in the area like Lux).  I had some errands to run in Cen Pho and I really didn't want to totally derail my diet for lunch. So I did a yelp search for salads and this popped up. Imagine my delight to find all raving reviews! I headed over immediately.  I love the atmosphere. It's really cute and cozy, but a little industrial too with the concrete floors and counters. Love, love the teal chairs, white brick walls and fresh flowers.  Anyway, the service, while nice, was pretty aloof. And it wasn't busy so I don't know what the deal was. Perhaps they were busy making call in lunch orders that I was ignored?  I got a small spinach salad. For $4 I felt the portion was fair. However, my salad was supposed to come with Pomagranate and it didn't have it on there. I initially wanted to try the soup but they had run out (by noon?).  I got a Belgian waffle for my son. My salad came out (which took awhile), I finished it and we were still waiting on the waffle. I was trying to catch the eye of one of the employees because my son was really hungry, and he's 4 so he was about to go postal.  Finally a young girl asked of there was anything else, and I reminded her of the waffle and cookie we ordered. Her response was oh sorry that wasn't on the ticket (she was being polite not snarky - never know how that might come across in a review). But she was the one who took my order so I was confused as to how those items were left off the ticket.  Anyway, the waffle and cookie finally came out. They were really good. In fact, the food is really good and fresh. No doubt about that.  But my overall experience was just weird. In fact on the way out, a gentleman asked how was everything and I was like ok, food was good but it took a long time and the Pomagranate was left off my salad. His response, were there pomagranates supposed to be on your salad? I was like yeah all the ingredients of the salad are right here on the menu. He just shrugged his shoulders and said yeah it happens sometimes. He wasn't rude, but dismissive. Didn't apologize or anything.  As I walked out, one of the ladies was rolling out dough to make cinnamon rolls. They are probably delicious.   They seem like super nice people who serve good food. But they could use improvement on the customer service and efficiency.

8n1oVyiBUq6RU5hnNsOipw.text: I like this place. Good cold brew coffee, good club sandwiches, good lemon bars (probably the best I've had.) It's a good place write, too. There's a covered patio out back away from the road with tables and a little garden. At 1pm on a Saturday, I'm the only one out here. It's really nice.

oUaPcm4YlJW4zjZAtZNnvg.text: Wish I could give this place 2.5 stars.   Pluses: the patio was seriously adorable and provided a quiet, green respite on a sunny day. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I didn't try anything in the pastry case, but everything looked delicious!   Minuses: The sandwiches we ordered were fine, but they were very small/thin for the price and came with no side, not even chips or a little piece of fruit or some such. The lemonade was so tart that it was actually uncomfortable to drink. It was pretty much straight lemon juice. We both had to wait until the ice melted and add more water and sugar in order to stomach it, so be forewarned!

Spa36RZB0r2_5IfJLtakLA.text: My family eat everything we ordered at Ollie Vaughn's and then I remembered I need to share pics so future visitor have something to see. Just take my word for it--Ollie Vaughn's has really good food. The Key Lime Pie taste like my homemade pie--at least that's what my son said. He also said they make the best Cuban Sandwich he ever tasted. The staff were all very friendly and nice. Can't wait for our next visit.

gDWbymzLcYiWr_CGd9uRsg.text: There are a handful of restaurants that never fail to delight our family or our invited guests:  bianco's, binks, tuck shop (well, former tuck shop before the new owners), and now Ollie Vaughn's.  Friendly neighborhood service, where locals go to meet and chat.  Don't go there in a rush, your order is made from scratch, delicious every time.

woZu8uU92MUk_nXJcrAOoQ.text: The food, personnel, decor and vibe are all great at Ollie Vaughn's. I visited for the first time on Saturday. The Cubano was an excellent sandwich, but the only negative was the wait. I came in around 10am and it took nearly 30 minutes for my sandwich to come out. So, the wait was not ideal, but I enjoyed everything else.

CtAD-powzc-qroLEG2veMw.text: Can't wait to go back and try breakfast :) small family owned. They really care, they place is clean. Great Iced teas and iced coffees. really enjoyed!

o_xwMkWcVOiWG-BoZ7kP5w.text: Let me explain. I love the food and the pastries but the coffee is bad.  The atmosphere is amazing but I don't want to come here because they don't have quality coffee.   I'm sorry. I'm really picky about coffee. Please refer to stumptown, intelligentsia, cartel, or anywhere in Ethiopia.

1oCqTnMM933s0IkNM8AB3w.text: I have always heard good things about this place so I stopped in the other day. I ordered a breakfast sandwich that was made with a super crispy and flakey croissant that was to die for. The bacon in it was extra crispy which made for an awesome sandwich and paired great with the egg and cheese. I had to get a chocolate chip cookie too because they looked way too good, no surprise it was the best chocolate chip cookie I have had. So soft and flavorful the chocolate was amazing. Price was a little high but I'll definitely be back for those lemon bars and nutella rolls.

qeVmIyqPBtoqBvZcaDDqeA.text: Didn't even realize this little gem existed; so unassuming! Loved the large windows and open space, as well as the lovely and unexpected garden in the back. We had a unique twist on pancakes with the ricotta pancakes--you'll just have to try them to know what I mean! Also ordered a breakfast sandwich with caramelized onions, avocado and sausage on a croissant (which I think was made in-house!?).

s0um4gGGQKhhKFM79oWrgg.text: Excellent lunch spot found thanks to Yelp! This is the second time I've grabbed lunch from OV's and has been amazing on both occasions. My Gemini-ness requires me to try things twice before forming a final opinion and mine rates is very high on this lunch joint! I went with the tuna salad sandwich on sourdough this time around and an iced mocha latte. Coffee was fresh brewed after ordering and was much better than anticipated. The bread was just then toasted then topped with generous portions of tuna salad and a house mix of veggies. Will definitely be a reoccurring lunch meal for me from now on!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna Salad sandwich on sourdough

i6LmHm6_C4i-sCzGrfD1Zg.text: Totally unexpected awesome coffee/breakfast/lunch spot in the ghetto.  Stumbled across Ollie's while working across the street at the homeless youth drop-in center, and I was totally surprised to find that gentrification was happening even here. I mean, I understand that hipsters are into gentrification. It's what they do. And generally speaking I'm totally in favor of gentrification. But this is a truly decrepit part of the ghetto. Strip joints, homeless shelters, etc. Lots of hipster joints move onto the border of the ghetto, or into an area that's already been hipsterized. Ollie's has nerve to move onto McDowell and Food City, so props to them.  In the spirit of Ollie Vaughn's, here's my theory on the beautiful process of gentrification in the urban ecosystem:  1) A city starts 2) Everybody lives together 3) Industry springs up in the downtown area 4) Rich people don't want to live next to industry/poor people 5) --} suburbs 6) Downtown becomes "ghetto" 7) Low housing prices attract hipsters 8) Hipsters start Ollie Vaughn's 9) Poor people/hipsters coexist 10) Area becomes "trendy" thanks to Ollie Vaughn's 11) More hipsters 12) More trendy 13) MORE HIPSTERS 14) Hipster critical mass reached, housing prices skyrocket 15) Rich millennials move in from suburbs 16) ^ housing prices even more 17) Poor people can't afford housing 18) Poor people move to X suburb, where rich people used to live 19) Full gentrification achieved, hipsters mourn mecca 20) Repeat cycle in new poor neighborhood, starting at #7  The way I see it hipsters are like the gastrointestinal process. You start with something totally useless, like a $7 breakfast sandwich, after yelp check in, loaded with carmelized onions, arugula, tomatoes and bacon. An Ollie Vaughn breakfast sandwich. You're body doesn't know what to do with the sandwich. So you put it in your mouth and eat it. And like hipsters in the ghetto, your digestive process starts breaking down this delicious meal into things it can use. Bacon turns into a new protein molecule, maybe a gym in an abandoned warehouse. The croissant turns into a trendy new carbohydrate, maybe an upscale loft converted from a brick and mortar department store. The arugula turns into fiber, which, like the hipsters themselves, helps push all the poor byproduct out of this newly re-energized system so that it can go stink up some other neighborhood, ultimately serving as fertilizer for the next arugula plant to grow.  And they really do have good coffee, and their breakfast sandwiches are bomb, and occasionally they play rare old-timey Western tunes. So come here and eat, and maybe give a dime to the homeless dude in the parking lot while you can. He'll be gone soon enough, and this neighborhood will be bland once again, with only Ollie Vaughn's here to remind us of what was.  Pros: Delicious food, gentrification Cons: Poverty: coming to a neighborhood near you

yB_zdea8wcHERBBFQzMzXw.text: Standing ovation to Ollie Vaughn's! That was the exact breakfast I wanted - hash browns in Waffle House style with a fresh, delicious breakfast sandwich crafted to perfection. This place is definitely a must have!

RBAb__CnM4kOC86V4384ig.text: This place is unique for sure. Menu sounds delicious. Nothing fancy but nothing insignificant either. I ordered the biscuit and gravy plate, it was ok. Honestly overpriced for what your getting. Too damn much. Will not be coming here ever again. I only came here because I accompanied two ladies from work and they drove. Another thing I observed while standing alongside the counter was that the guy cooking an egg, after he had cooked it he placed it on the white board adjacent to the grill. Shouldn't it go straight on the plate? I only say this because many different things are being cut on that white board.

lp9G2joyUdUCZOQ7_Ng2lg.text: I really enjoyed my breakfast here. It's pretty straightforward dining with a smallish menu, but delicious. Worst part about the meal was the wait for the lemonade, but i gather they picked the lemons from the backyard and made it fresh.

znw_fUY28j_BL2YUCxQurw.text: I love stopping in for a quick coffee or meeting someone for lunch (Brie sandwich is bomb diggity BTW). I've had a few different items off of their menu and everything has been yummy. I also like that they have a variety of hot sauces to choose from, but if I could make one suggestion it would be to add Tapatio to that selection ;)

I also purchased a cinnamon roll which wasn't traditional but it was really good! The atmosphere is adorable, cool vibes

vc0w0N3Q3GG_-ywXeAwv8A.text: Inside: cute and has a nice flow.  Food quality: pretty decent. I felt that they  just clumped everything in my salad.  Food quantity: not great. I mean, I get that these salads are supposed to be unique and small but I mean, for $8.00 and no meat I wasn't necessarily impressed.  Speed: bad. It took them 50 minutes to 1 hour to get 2 salads, 2 sandwiches and 1 soup. I get it, they might have been rushed before hand but there was ZERO communication about it. I truly found the food to be up to par but not necessarily good for the price. I don't know that I'll come back.   I will say the pastries/desserts looked pretty delicious though!

n-HXnJY4RIT4Ls_bgVxWlw.text: It took a long time to get our food, as they had a big catering order...however, my breakfast sandwich was D-Lish. I can't wait to return to knock off some of the lunch time sandwiches. I love all sorts of sandwiches. ;)

kq5GymkCjMGGpacw2ZrreA.text: Food is amazing ... service is terrible ... apparently if you come in while there is a line ... and show that you have cash ... you're allowed to be served before everyone who has been waiting ... and of course what we were waiting in line for ... that person got the last of ... they should put a sign out that says cash for faster service. GbwWo5aiqEeF4N5XPpkUlA.text: This place is awesome. I was worried about their coffee because I work with it and I read one pretty discouraging review about their latte, but I was pleasantly surprised! I got their iced toddy and added chocolate, but I thought it tasted good even black. It has a slightly tart taste without seeming too acidic. I loved my breakfast sandwich; they house make their croissants and biscuits and I had large selection of customizable options for the fillings. I got sausage, Gruyere, caramelized onions, roasted pepper, and avocado on a croissant-- so good! Basically, whatever the bad reviews say, TRY it anyway. I bet you'll be glad you did.

TWwEsQfsYcNCxuWeBuvchA.text: A hidden gem that I likely would've only found because of yelp! Everything is made fresh and they have a great porch out back. Perfect for pets. They even brought out a few pieces of bacon for the dog. The biscuits and gravy were delicious! Not too heavy, but very filling.

-uI9_3Dwt8n3uWKje4Vp1g.text: This is my go to brunch or lunch treat! Every time I have gone I'm greeted by fun and smiling staff, my food is always delicious and just what I wanted, and I love the open kitchen. With its cute inside decor and nice back patio, I think it's a must for anyone wanting a nice breakfast/lunch/brunch on their own, with a friend, or with a small group. And if it's a Treat Yo Self day, get the oatmeal cream pie! Holy cow those things are good!!!

QILYfC8Ob6npH2gCIzbdLQ.text: First customers on a Sunday morning, not busy at all, and we had to wait 45mins for our food. Once it came, our food was delicious though. Customers shouldn't have to wait so long in an empty restaurant while 7 employees are doing prep work for their day ahead instead of cooking for customers that are present and have already placed their orders.

29ib8ThI2S8O7Sbse6Tm2g.text: Stopped by before flying home because the reviews were so good. This place was perfect. Delicious food and quick service

WLVPYAOAVpkC9OrKW7BO3Q.text: this place was my first spot upon my first visit in Arizona! it was around the corner of my hotel & had good yelp reviews. I decided to come here with my husband & we ordered their famous breakfast sandwiches. it was as good as the locals described. however, they misplaced my order & charged me for a piece of cake when I didn't order any pastry & cooked my husbands egg over easy when he requested medium cooked. so, that was upsetting.   I informed them I was charged extra & they never came back around to refund me or apologize. that was even more upsetting. Also, the portion of the breakfast sandwich was small. it did not fill up my stomach. overall, besides the confusion & extra charge, it's still a place to stop by.

OYZxnfuK7j8cK8-QGrIuoQ.text: Came here for an early lunch. Got a charred grilled cheese and a kale salad, and I must say IT WAS FREAKIN DELICIOUS!   We split the two and it was the perfect amount of food, and at 11 bucks you can't beat it. The staff here is super awesome, always helpful and friendly, and the space is great. I would rank the patio as one of my favorites in town. The pastries also look delectable.   All in all, if you want a good breakfast or lunch, GO TO OLLIE VAUGHN'S!

photos.caption: Photo of Ollie Vaughn's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey Club and a Kale Salad and a killer patio. What else do you need?

rqa-sOQM07dh4FX6TvNuhQ.text: My husband and I came by Sunday morning for a late breakfast. We live in the neighborhood and thought a visit to this place was long overdue. We were greeted by a friendly gal with a quick "hi" as soon as we entered but that was truly the extent of any and all pleasantries.  There was a couple at the counter that appeared to making a "to go" order (with a server/cashier that looked beyond annoyed at them) so we waited behind them as we didn't see any signage to seat ourselves or to wait to be seated. Since it was our first time there and not in a hurry, we waited. It took about 3 minutes for the couple in front of us to finish their order and pay and we realized when they said they were not taking their food to go that this was how you order your food; at the counter, pre-pay and then they bring you your food. It makes it a bit awkward having to decide at the counter what you want but since the couple before us took so long, we were ready with our order.   I ordered the brioche french toast with fruit compote and my husband ordered the ricotta pancakes. We paid using their app and I personally felt it was odd to "pre tip" on a meal for which we had not been served yet. I guess if you decide you want to order something else after you start eating, you have to go back up front, wait in line and tip again. We paid our bill and started looking for seating. It was a nice morning (and to be honest the music inside was too loud), so we opted to sit outside.   There was no music at all outside which again was odd.. it would have been nice to have been piped outside but at a much lower level. Our food came out about 10 minutes after we ordered it and I was disappointed that my "fruit compote" consisted of sliced strawberries. Yes, I was expecting an actual compote so if you are a restaurant and you put compote on your menu, expect to disappoint when you do not deliver. The brioche french toast was actually decent but I realized that neither one of us had utensils. I had to ask the server if he could bring them and he told me they were self serve and in the restaurant. I don't have a problem getting my own silverware, but again, it would have been nice to know that so I could have gotten them before I was served. It was kind of gross that the fresh silverware and napkins sit atop a metal cart with everyone's dirty plates and uneaten food piled up in plastic bins underneath the cart. Another thing I realized at this point is that I guess not only do we get our own silverware, we also bus our own table at the end of the meal. So what exactly is that tip for??  My husband liked the ricotta pancakes but thought they were a bit wet. He was expecting compote too, so we both felt a bit cheated.   To sum it up, this place has potential but it needs a lot in the way of signage, service and accurate descriptions of their menu offerings. Everyone with the exception of the first gal when we walked in had a chip on their shoulder, so we could do without the attitude. There is definite room to improve here but they have a long way to go.

AUp7qtLkAs3RXo2bEghOVQ.text: Don't even think of stopping at rainbow donuts, not when this place is a block away.   So glad I spotted in in a whim (ok, the sign said pie, i couldn't resist).  The croissant pudding is yum.  Loved the oatmeal pie, its two oatmeal coolies with buttercream in the middle.  But the current winner for me is the ricotta pancakes.  They have a hint of lemon and poppyseeds.   The interior is light and airy.  Minimalist but comfy.  The staf is friendly, and took the time to chat with me when I came in.  Oh and free WiFi!

dxlfWbUEe_PHJhkYDdWExw.text: I made a stop in because I always see a friend post about this place. On my way home from work I decided to get my fiance and I a couple of breakfast sandwiches. The place is nice a little rustic with an outside eating area in the back. My order was done very quick and the girl in the front was very nice. I ordered two breakfast sandwiches one with bacon and the other with sausage. When I got home and took my first bite I was in heaven. You can tell these biscuits were made with a lot of love. Every bite was more and more delicious, I thought to myself why have I never tried this place before?considering it had been there for 4 years!!! I can't wait to go back and try more off this delicious menu (green chili pork).
